Bharat Hotels operates several five-star hotels and resorts across the country and its flagship property is Th... Read More

NEW DELHI: The income tax department said on Friday its searches on a “hospitality group” has led to the detection of undisclosed foreign assets of more than Rs 1,000 crore, days after it conducted searches on Bharat Hotels that owns the Lalit chain of hotels and Cargo Motors . In addition, domestic tax evasion of more than Rs 35 crore has been detected, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said in a statement that did not name any entity.

The department said that may lead to lead to consequences under the Black Money Act, 2015, as also, action under the Income-tax Act, 1961. Foreign assets include investment in a hotel in UK, immovable properties in UK and UAE and deposits with foreign banks, the tax department said, adding that further investigations are in progress. It did not name the group.

The tax department on Monday had conducted raids at the premises of Bharat Hotels chairperson and managing director Jyotsna Suri and her associates in connection with an alleged tax evasion case. Bharat Hotels operates several five-star hotels and resorts across the country and its flagship property is The Lalit in central Delhi.

Repeated calls and text messages to the group did not elicit any response till the time of going to the press.

The department had also raided the premises of Jyotsna’s brother Jayant Nanda, managing director of Cargo Motors, the largest dealer of Tata Motors ’ commercial vehicles in the country. A known name in the auto business, Nanda has dealership outlets in Delhi, Gujarat, Punjab and Rajasthan. Sources had said that eight locations were covered in the raids which continued late into the evening. The tax department did not share any details of the operation. However, sources had said transactions of the two groups, which were being probed, were related.

Jyotsna, a former chairman of industry body Ficci, has been associated with the Bharat Hotels group since 1989 and took over as CMD in 2006 after the death of her husband Lalit Suri. Lalit Suri shot into prominence because of his close links with Congress but fell out with the party. A man known for his contacts across the political spectrum, he entered Rajya Sabha from UP with support from the BJP and the SP.

The tax department said that taking forward the mission of the government against black money, particularly undisclosed foreign assets, authorities conducted searches on January 19, on this group which has been on their radar for having substantial undisclosed foreign assets. The operation covered 13 premises in the national capital region.

“The group is a leading member of the hospitality industry, running a hotel abroad and a chain of luxury hotels under a prominent brand name, situated at various locations in India,” the CBDT said.

The search operation has so far resulted in seizure of unaccounted assets valued at Rs. 24.93 crore (cash of Rs. 71.5 lakh, jewellery worth Rs.23 crore and expensive watches valued at Rs.1.2 crore), the tax department said.

“Evidence seized during the search reveals that a large amount of black money was stashed abroad by the group, through the mechanism of trusts, formed in early 1990s in tax havens,” the CDBT said.

It said such foreign holdings of the main persons have remained hidden for decades beneath complex multi layered structures, located in different countries, ensuring secrecy. Search action further revealed that one of the close relatives of the promoter family was intentionally introduced as a front to ostensibly escape the provisions of domestic tax laws.

Title: CAA effect? Number of Bangladeshi illegals exiting up, says BSF
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

BSF soldiers patrol the India-Bangladesh border in Dharmanagar on Friday. (PTI photo)

KOLKATA: The number of illegal Bangladeshi immigrants trying to exit India through the porous land border has “increased substantially”, though it can’t be called an “exodus” as of now, according to the Border Security Force .

BSF troops along the 913-km south Bengal frontier apprehended 268 Bangladeshi nationals — nearly 90% of them going back to Bangladesh from India — in the first 23 days of 2020, BSF inspector-general (South Bengal Frontier) Y B Khurania said in Kolkata on Friday. Most of them used the international border in North 24 Parganas ’ Ghojadanga, he added.

Prodded by journalists whether this rise could be attributed to the new citizenship law, Khurania said that might be the case. “We believe that it is because of our increased vigil that fewer people from Bangladesh are trying to illegally enter India. Most of those without valid documents apprehended by us near the border were on their way out. But there seems to be no exodus-like situation,” Khurania said.

“We apprehended 1,677 Bangladeshis without valid papers in 2018 (or a daily average of 4.5) and 2,194 in 2019 (or a daily average of 6) and most of them were India-bound. But, in 2020, we have already apprehended 268 Bangladeshis (almost 12 daily) and 90% of them were returning to Bangladesh,” he added. Officials said all these figures pertained to only the 913-km south Bengal frontier (about a fourth of the total length of the India-Bangladesh border). Fewer people may have actually tried to cross over into India from Bangladesh illegally fearing detection by agencies after the passage of the CAA, they said.

Title: Bihar: Doctors, Gaya airport alerted against coronavirus
Content:
File photo used for representational purpose

PATNA: The state health department has sounded an alert against the new coronavirus (CoV) which has infected large number of people in China and killed 26 till Friday afternoon. The civil surgeons have been instructed to orient their health workers, stock up sufficient number of masks and form a sample collecting team to tackle any emergency situation.State surveillance officer Dr Ragani Mishra said though the virus had not been detected in India and people should not panic. She further said Union ministry of health and family welfare, in coordination with civil aviation authority, has issued advisory to all the international airports.“This virus is so new that even its incubation period is not known. Hence, it is better to take precaution and create awareness. Also, no one has come to Bihar from China recently, but students or any individual of our state staying in China can return. So, we have to be on alert,” she said.In the instructions given to the districts, civil surgeons have been told to form a district surveillance unit, a sample collecting team in each government medical college and hospital and ensure sufficient stock of masks. Mishra said the sample collected will be sent to National Institute of Virology in Pune for test.Union ministry of health and family welfare regional director (Bihar and Jharkhand) Dr Kailash Kumar said Gaya airport authorities have been instructed in this regard.There are daily flights from Gaya to Bangkok and Yangon till March-April, three flights in a week to Paro from December to February or extended up to March and one weekly flight to Hanoi from October to March.“Airport authorities have been told to distribute pamphlets with symptoms of the new virus. People infected with this virus suffer from Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), fever and cough. They face problem in breathing because of lack of oxygen,” said Dr Kailash, recalling the 2003 SARS outbreak which had infected thousands of people and killed many.Gaya airport director Dillip Kumar said though they do not have any flight from China, still the precautions were being taken because people do come from other countries, including Singapore where one confirmed case has been reported. “One terminal manager here has been made the nodal officer. If he gets any such case, then he will report the matter to the civil surgeon. Even the cabin crew have been oriented and have been told not to take anyone on board with CoV symptoms. However, if anyone develops the symptom on a flight, the crew will inform the pilot, who will alert the air traffic controller and then to terminal manager. That passenger will be isolated and taken to the medical emergency room,” said Dillip.He also said no passenger was found with the symptoms of coronavirus till Friday.

Title: Patna gears up for Saraswati Puja
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

A girl adds final touches to idols of Goddess Saraswati in Patna

PATNA: Artisans and sculptors are working around the clock to prepare idols of Goddess Saraswati for Basant Panchami celebrations on January 29. They are now giving final touches to their creations.

Raju Prasad, an artisan on Bailey Road , had started making Saraswati idols in November last year. He told this newspaper on Friday, “They are in high every year because of which I start making them two or three months before the festival. Since I use mud, the idols take a lot of time to dry, especially during the winter season when the weather is foggy.”

Another artisan, Prabhakar Kumar, makes use of plaster, instead of mud. He said, “My idols are lightweight and take lesser time to dry.”

Like Prabhakar, Rajesh also uses plaster. “I have made more than 100 idols. I only have to colour them now,” he said.

City students are also ready to worship Goddess Saraswati, who is the epitome of knowledge, music, art, wisdom, and learning, in their respective schools, colleges, and coaching institutes. A number of them have collected money for buying idols as well as sweets and setting up pandals.

Sajid Khan, who studies in a private college on Boring Road, said, “My friends and I have been setting up a Saraswati Puja pandal outside our college for the last two years. Since this is our last year here, we have decided to celebrate the festival on a bigger scale.”

Meanwhile, district magistrate (DM) Kumar Ravi said several artificial ponds would be made near rivers for the immersion of Saraswati idols. “The Patna Municipal Corporation has been instructed to look after the arrangements. Besides, idol makers have been told to use very less chemical colours,” the DM said.

Title: West Bengal: Republic Day security focus on metro stations, tourist spots
Content:
Security personnel on Red Road on Friday

KOLKATA: Sunday will witness unprecedented security, not only on Red Road where the Republic Day Parade will be held, but also across Kolkata and the districts of Bengal. While multiple teams will patrol the Hooghly to keep watch on the banks, special attention will be paid to Metro stations and places of tourist attraction where crowds are expected to gather.“Red Road will be out of bounds for traffic from 10pm on Saturday. It has been divided into 20 sectors with a deputy commissioner-level officer in charge of each. Nearly 4,000 policemen will be deployed across Kolkata and about 2,000 of them will be on duty around Red Road alone. The area will also have 10 sand bunkers, 10 watch towers and six protective cabins, along with a dozen help desks. There will be 23 Radio Flying Squads and 11 Heavy Radio Flying Squads across the city,” a senior Kolkata Police officer said.While chief minister Mamata Banerjee will reach Red Road at 9.52am, Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar will arrive three minutes later. The National Flag will be hoisted at 9.59am, following which the parade will start — at 10am. This year, the parade commander will be Brigadier V M Chandran, deputy GOC, Bengal Sub-Area of the Army. The Army contingent will comprise armoured personnel carriers and howitzers. Contingents from the Indian Air Force, Navy, Kolkata Police, West Bengal Police and the NCC will also march past the saluting dais, followed by tableaux.Kolkata Police has still not disclosed the parking arrangement around Red Road and a final decision will be taken depending on the situation later on. “There will be special attention on places like the zoo, Victoria Memorial Hall, shopping malls and places of worship where large numbers of people are expected to gather on the national holiday. Local police stations have been asked to collect information on special events and rallies being organized in neighbourhoods and make arrangements to prevent any untoward incident,” the officer added.

Title: Four held, three FIRs lodged after BJP-TMC clash in Dhakuria
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Cops set up barricades around Lake police station on Friday

KOLKATA: Four persons, including two women — all reportedly BJP supporters — were arrested after overnight raids since Thursday for being involved in the sporadic clashes between Trinamool Congress and BJP in Dhakuria after BJP’s door-to-door campaign canvassing support for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act 2019. On Friday morning, several hundred BJP supporters gheraoed the Lake police station for nearly an hour, protesting the “selective” arrests and the police’s reported refusal to accept a BJP complaint. In all, three separate FIRs have been registered over the incident — one each by cops, Trinamool and BJP.

Police said the four who were arrested — Balaram Singh, Kiran Singh, Kabita Sardar and Susmita Halder — were remanded in jail custody till January 31. All are Rahim Ostagar Lane residents.

The violence that was reported briefly by TOI on Friday left a Kolkata Police anti-rowdy squad officer injured. Eight others were also reportedly injured. A Trinamool supporter, sources said, is still being treated in a hospital. The officer, Pushpal Bhattacharya, sustained serious injuries in three fingers and had to get seven stitches. The attack on the officer prompted the Lake police to draw up a suo motu FIR on the incident. The Trinamool also submitted a complaint alleging their workers were severely assaulted and some women members were molested.

According to sources, the incident took place during BJP’s pro-CAA campaign on Rahim Ostagar Lane. The clashes were triggered after a row between rival party workers when BJP workers passed by a Trinamool party office. The clashes turned violent with a parked bike nearly being set ablaze and around eight persons of either group sustaining injuries. Police said most of these injuries were minor with only one still recuperating in a local hospital.

A senior BJP leader said, “The attack was pre-planned. Our supporters were attacked. Some are injured. The police did not accept our complaint and arrested our party workers instead. To protest against this, we gathered at the Lake police station and demonstrated. Police were then forced to accept our complaint.” However, a local Trinamool leader said, “BJP supporters instigated the clash when they were passing by our party office. They assaulted our workers and did not spare the women. We have lodged a police complaint.”

Officers said the Lake police station was sealed during the protests and additional forces had been sent there. “The situation is tense, but under control. Additional forces will be stationed there from now,” an officer said.

The cops said all complaints have been accepted.

Title: Siemens to buy 99% in C&S Electric for Rs 2,100 crore
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: In what is its first M&A in India, German industrial icon Siemens has agreed to buy New Delhi-based C&S Electric for 267 million euros (Rs 2,100 crore). The purchase, subject to Competition Commission of India’s approval, has been routed through its local listed subsidiary Siemens Limited. This is also the largest domestic M&A announced this year.

Siemens Limited will acquire 99.22% from R N Khanna and his brother Ashok Khanna, the promoters of C&S Electric, and plans to make an offer to minority shareholders holding the balance 0.78%. The company intends to keep C&S Electric as a separate entity and not merge with itself in the immediate future.

The acquisition strengthens Siemens’s India position as a key supplier of low-voltage electrical products and solutions. Siemens had pioneered the switchgear market globally and in India. C&S Electric, with a turnover of Rs 1,241 crore in fiscal 2019, has more than 5,000 employees across multiple locations, including three manufacturing units in Noida, Haridwar and Guwahati.

Siemens Limited, however, will not be acquiring C&S Electric’s medium-voltage switchgear business in India as well as its China and Belgium units. This is because Siemens already has a presence in the medium voltage switchgear business and C&S Electric’s portfolio overlaps with it. “The low-voltage products complements the company’s offerings,” said Sunil Mathur, managing director & CEO, Siemens Limited.

The company’s history in India dates to 1867 when Werner von Siemens personally supervised the laying of the first telegraph line between London and Calcutta. It today has 21 factories in India, employs 10,000 people and has a revenue of Rs 13,323 crore. “Siemens’s objective has always been profitable growth. This growth has been through the organic way and hence not tapped acquisitions, until the company found an opportunity in C&S Electric,” said Mathur.

The electrical systems division is the second-largest contributor to Siemens Limited’s revenue after energy solutions. The deal, advised by Ambit and S&R Associates, comes nearly two years after French major Schneider announced plans to purchase Larsen & Toubro’s electrical and automation business in India.

Siemens Limited expects the C&S Electric transaction to be completed before the end of this year. The announcement was made after the stock market had closed. On Friday, the shares of Siemens Limited ended at Rs 1,626 on the NSE, up 2.7%.

Title: Paytm moves against fraudsters, files FIR
Content:
(File photo)

BENGALURU: To fight the rising menace of online fraud by cyber crooks resulting in consumers losing money, Paytm Payments Bank — which houses the Paytm e-wallet — has handed over 3,500 numbers to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai), the ministry of home affairs (MHA) and CERT-In, the cybersecurity agency.It has also filed a first-information report (FIR) with Noida police’s cyber wing against the 3,500 numbers which, the company believes, are behind online frauds. Paytm hopes the government and the telecom regulator could use the database to stop the fraud attempts on consumers.In October, TOI reported how seven internet-based companies had come together to share data with the Reserve Bank of India, State Bank of India and other relevant stakeholders to fight rising online frauds.Along with the list of offenders, a list of SMS shortcodes was given to the authorities. SMS shortcodes are essential tools to use the company’s name falsely to fool consumers. For example, one of the most used shortcode is Pytm, mimicking Paytm. This can deceive a consumer to believe the text is coming officially from Paytm.“Telecom operators should be directed to have stringent control on the issuance of shortcodes for bulk messages to companies. There is also a need to blacklist companies permitting such SMSs to be sent,” said Paytm Payments Bank managing director & CEO Satish Gupta.In its communication to Trai, Paytm has stressed on the need to give financial institutions the authority to raise requests with telecom companies for the immediate blocking of phone numbers and shortcodes sending fraudulent SMS.

Title: Mastercard’s swipe makes Pine Labs 1st unicorn in 2020
Content: BENGALURU: Point-of-sales (PoS) services provider Pine Labs has raised a new round of funding from the global card network major Mastercard . While transaction details were not disclosed, the new round is pegged at $100-150 million (Rs 713-1,069 crore). This will make the Sequoia-backed Pine Labs the first Indian unicorn in 2020 with a valuation of $1.5-1.6 billion, said one of the sources briefed on the deal.In a prepared statement, Pine Labs said it will work with Mastercard to deliver a range of card and real-time payments-based instalment financing at checkout — both in-store and online. The funding comes at a time when the company has been expanding its lending business with debit and credit card-based financing options for consumers in partnership with banks and merchants.It has about 1.4 lakh merchants across 4.5 lakh network points. It already offers working capital loans and the company also set up a unit called Pine Labs Finance earlier last year. One of Pine Labs’s core sources of revenue is from the monthly fee it gets from its PoS machines.Pine Labs claimed it processes payments to the tune of $30 billion in one year. Its services include payments acceptance technology, stored value products, in-store consumer credit and other merchant solutions. TOI had reported in its October 10 edition that Pine Labs is eyeing a valuation of around $1.5 billion for its new round and has mandated JPMorgan for the deal.The company is an early bet by Sequoia Capital India, which invested in it about 11 years ago and now owns a majority stake. Prior to this, Pine Labs had raised over $200 million (Rs 1,426 crore) from US payments giant PayPal, besides financial investors like Temasek, Actis and Altimeter Capital. A large part of this capital was spent last year to acquire online gift cards company Qwikcilver for $110 million (Rs 784 crore).“Together, we have a unique opportunity to use Mastercard’s global presence and technology infrastructure to enhance our growth and enable us to meet the growing needs of customers in India and beyond,” said Lokvir Kapoor, founder and chairman of Pine Labs.

Title: Multiple fires had broken out at Raghuvir Celeum Textile Market
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Surat: It was not a single fire but multiple fires that broke out in A and C wings of Raghuvir Celeum Textile Market in Saroli on Puna-Kumbhariya Road, which ended up completely destroying about 600 shops on January 20. Fire officials say the fire could have started on second floor of a wing and on the top floor of another simultaneously. Forensic Science Laboratory experts are trying to find out how the fire started. Last year’s data shows several fire incidents occurring in textile markets in the months of January, February and March.

NV Upadhayay, deputy commissioner in-charge of fire and emergency services in Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC), said, “Contrary to general perception, there were multiple fires in the two wings of the building. Simultaneous fires atop C wing and on second floor of A wing gave a scary picture. On first day, the flames were witnessed on right side and next day, they had engulfed the left portion.”

Another senior official said some types of fire spread through AC and electrical ducts. Storage of combustible material could result in early flames while it takes take time at other places. “This incident is suspicious because just 10 days ago there was a fire in its premises. Possibility of mischief cannot be ruled out,” the officer added.

“The mystery of this fire remains unresolved. In the past too, the city has witnessed many such fires with the exact cause remaining unknown. It seems not a single fire but multiple fires that engulfed the major portions of the textile market,” Upadhayay added.

Fire and emergency services department records indicate that fire calls from textile markets almost double from January to March compared to other months of the year. “It is strange, but figures show that number of fire calls for some unknown reasons increase two-fold during the first three months of the year. Majority of these fires take place during night or early morning hours,” said Basant Pareek, chief fire officer, SMC.

Title: Guv asks state to train farmers in natural farming
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Acharya Devvrat presided over 61st AAU convocation

Vadodara/ Anand: Gujarat government should train at least 25,000 farmers in natural farming. This is what Acharya Devvrat, state governor, suggested on Friday.

Devvrat, who presided over the 16th annual convocation ceremony of Anand Agricultural University (AAU), has been advocating a shift towards natural farming.

He said Himachal Pradesh government had fixed a target to train and cover around 50,000 farmers under natural farming in the current financial year. Expressing satisfaction over the progress made by the Himachal Pradesh government in the direction of natural farming, he urged Gujarat government to start training farmers in this direction.

The governor said he had about 25 years of practical experience on chemical and organic farming but ultimately had to switch over to natural farming as it was beneficial in many ways.

“It helps in protecting our environment, improve soil fertility, decrease cost of production and improves economic condition of the farmers,” he said.

During the convocation ceremony, 99 students received gold medals while a total of 719 students were conferred with degrees. The governor, who is also chancellor of the state agriculture university, appealed to the students to remain students throughout their lives by remaining connected to farming. “Knowledge should not remain restricted to universities. Instead, it should reach the end beneficiary,” he said.

Title: Mayor calls urgent GB, set to oppose Raut’s plan of NIT’s comeback
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: Mayor Sandip Joshi has called for an urgent special general body meeting of the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) where the BJP is likely to pass a resolution opposing guardian minister Nitin Raut’s plan to put the Nagpur Improvement Trust back in charge of Gunthewari areas.

With this, the BJP, which is the ruling party in the civic body, seems to have decided to take the Maha Vikas Aghadi head-on after recent decisions which questioned the authority of the NMC. The meeting will be held in the Town Hall on Monday.

Normally, the general body is held once a month on or before 20th. A meeting has already taken place on January 20.

NMC sources told TOI that the BJP will ensure a resolution is passed for the complete dissolution of the NIT. “BJP is in majority in the house and will be able to achieve it,” they said.

The state urban development department had written a letter to municipal commissioner and NIT chairman on January 10 seeking their opinion on Raut’s plan. On the same day, municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar sought the views of the NMC town planning department.

Even before the department could come out with its views, Joshi has called for the meeting.

According to Raut, it is not mandatory on the state government to accept “the decisions taken by the NMC”. “The NMC house is a public body and can take its decision. However, the government can decide on its own too,” he said.

The state energy minster said former CM Devendra Fadnavis did not dissolve the NIT. “The agency still exists. Why didn’t the BJP not move ahead with its decision,” asked Raut.

According to Fadnavis, no city in India has two civic authorities in the same jurisdiction. “Nagpur has suffered enough due to conflict of jurisdiction. It would not be advisable to do it again,” he told TOI.

The Fadnavis government decided to dissolve the NIT last year on August 13 but never did so. The BJP government only took away the planning authority status of the NIT and made NMC the sole agency for the entire city.

The NIT continues to execute works in city even though the Nagpur Metropolitan Region Development Authority (NMRDA) was formed with NIT officials as its members.

TOI has a copy of Raut’s letter dated January 2 to CM Uddhav Thackeray on this issue.

He writes: “NIT regularized 2,200 unauthorized layouts, 14,000 unauthorized plots and executed developmental works of over Rs700 crore in regularized areas. NIT ensured successful development of the city. NIT was carrying out process to regularize remaining unauthorized layouts and develop areas. But NMC was made planning authority of NIT areas four months ago. NMC is not having expert and experienced officials and employees. NMC did nothing in the last four months. People are upset over pending works. NIT is having no works. Therefore, it is very important to control the situation and make NIT planning authority of Gunthewari areas.”

Title: Inaccessible narrow lanes add to hazards in Ring Road textile market
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Surat: Firefighters had an easy access to Raghuvir Celeum Textile Market on Puna-Kumbhariya Road in the city. However, this wouldn’t have been the scene had the textile market been part of the markets on Ring Road. Fire safety was probably the last thing that architects had kept in mind while designing the several textile markets here.

After the Raghuvir Celeum fire incident, the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) had ordered survey of all the textile markets. After a two-day survey, the civic body has identified more than 36 textile markets, which will pose serious threats in fire fighting exercise.

The main gates leading to the more than 36 textile markets here are totally rendered inaccessible for the fire tenders as these are either too narrow or covered with cement arcs and iron grills. The 36-odd markets house thousands of shops. The situation is even worse, particularly in the textile markets located behind the Surat Textile Market (STM) on Ring Road.

These markets, which register the highest presence of traders including transport vehicles loaded with highly inflammable polyester fabric material in peak hours after 4pm on any given day on both sides of the road, are fraught with hazards.

If not for the gates, a bigger challenge for the fire department is the rampant encroachments in the corridors of the textile markets by traders and dealers. Bundles of finished and unfinished fabrics could be seen lying in the corridors and in the parking area making matters even worse.

In-charge city engineer of SMC, Jatin Desai said, “Most of the markets in Ring Road do not have proper entry gates for the fire tenders to enter during emergency. At many markets, we found that there are no separate entry and exit for people to be evacuated safely. Keeping all these parameters in mind, we have issued notices to the market managements to comply with changes within seven days.”

Photo quotes

The textile markets flouting fire safety norms have seven days to comply or else the civic body will be forced to seal the markets

Jivan Patel, deputy commissioner (planning and development), SMC

Majority of the markets on Ring Road are constructed 35 years ago. After Takshashila fire incident, FOSTTA has been trying hard to make necessary changes in the textile markets. It is needed that the senior officers of SMC should sit with the market managements and guide them with necessary changes.

Champalal Bothra, vice-president, FOSTTA

We are ready to comply with all fire safety norms. In fact, our market has installed fire safety system to thwart any major incident. If our gates are narrow, we are ready to widen them in accordance with norms.

Krishna Banka, president of JJ A/C textile market

Title: Mobile eateries with LPG cylinders cook disaster for textile marts
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Eateries with LPG cylinders pose a grave threat

Surat: If you consider the hundreds of roadside foodstalls that line up here cooking recipes of disaster using LPG cylinders on the narrow lanes of Ring Road, Salabatpura and Sahara Darwaja — the textile markets are nothing less than powder kegs waiting to explode.

Along with transport vehicles loaded with unfinished and finished fabrics, the lanes are perennially chock-a-block with merchants who come here for business. These small-time vendors have encroached upon the footpaths to sell food items, close to the textile shops where such fabric-laden tempos are parked.

At Begumwadi in Salabatpura, the entire lane is encroached by such eateries. Due to the heavy influx of people including daily wagers, customers and traders, the stall owners do brisk business.

President of Federation of Surat Textile Traders’ Association (FOSTTA), Manoj Agarwal lamented, “We are really concerned with the presence of roadside eateries in the markets using LPG cylinders. We have repeatedly urged the civic body to remove these stalls permanently, but nothing has been done so far.”

Chief fire officer (CFO), Basant Pareek said, “A blast in the LPG cylinder could invite a big fire tragedy in the textile market area. All the eateries in Begumwadi and on the Ring Road are illegal and not registered with the SMC.”

Bhairav Desai, executive engineer, Limbayat zone said that the anti-encroachment department carries out regular exercise of removing these eateries from the textile market area. “However, they reappear after a few days. We seize the carts, but we can’t seize LPG cylinder as it comes under the purview of directorate of explosives,” Desai lamented.

Desai further said that the carts seized can be kept with the department for around 50 days after which going by the policy they will have to return the carts to the owners. “Meanwhile, these owners keep spare carts and during that period, they use these to run their business,” he added.

Title: SaaS startup LogiNext raises $39m
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Bengaluru: LogiNext , a software-as-a-service ( SaaS ) player focused on logistics space, has raised $39 million in a new round of funding from Steadview Capital and Tiger Global Management. The new funding values the Mumbai and Fremont, California-based startup at nearly $100 million.

The fresh funding round, which comes three and a half years after the company raised $10 million from China’s Alibaba and mobile payments major Paytm, takes its total capital raised to $50 million. “The biggest thing we did well was that we built the company in capital-efficient manner and became ebitda profitable in the last quarter. That is why we were able to command a higher multiple on the valuation,” said LogiNext founder and CEO Dhruvil Sanghvi, explaining the gap in the rounds of funding. He had set up the company along with his wife Manisha Raisighani, who is the CTO, in 2014.

With the fresh capital, LogiNext is looking to double its workforce of 125, of which 100 are in Mumbai, in the next 12 months. The startup is also looking at acquisitions of $3-5 million over the next couple of years.

LogiNext has built an end-to-end logistics management platform which helps companies in automated order management, route optimisation, and post-delivery processing and analytics, among other things. It has about 150 clients, which include companies like McDonalds, Decathlon and Singapore Post, while it is also in talks with 30 Fortune 500 companies to bring them on board as clients. While technology companies like Amazon and Uber are able to invest money to provide solutions, LogiNext’s target is traditional organisations which comprise 95% of its clients.

The new round will also see the exit of its angel investor Sanjay Mehta, who has recently set up venture firm 100X.vc. “In 2015, when we invested in LogiNext it was poised for accelerated growth, I used to call them Google for shipments & they have been true on their business plans. It is rare to see founders being able to walk the talk,” said Mehta.

Title: Bihar: UP police raid Arwal village in search of a terror suspect
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A joint team of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar police conducted raids in Arwal district on Friday in search of one Mohammad Mehmood alias Kalam for his alleged involvement in a terror funding case lodged in Gonda last year.

Mehmood (28), a resident of Motha village under Town police station in Arwal district, is also suspected to be involved in the bomb blast on a private school premises at Bangaon under Gonda district of UP on July 20 last year. Mehmood has been on the run since his name figured in the case.

The station house officer (SHO) of Arwal Town police station, Ranjeet Kumar Vats, said a police team led by RPF inspector Praveen Kumar sought cooperation for carrying out a raid on Mehmood’s village. “We cooperated with the UP police team in the operation,” he told this newspaper over phone.

According to police sources, the members of the raiding team, which consisted of RPF, vigilance and IT cell of UP police, quizzed the family members of Mehmood. A warrant of arrest is pending against him for having his close connections with those involved in terror funding from the UAE.

Mehmood’s name figured during interrogation of a suspect — Shahil Khan alias Md Ali — who was arrested from Bunkar Colony near Romania at Varanasi in August 2019. Shahil’s close aide Rasheed Ahmad, a resident of Ramgarh Dargah Sharif, was later arrested from Chunar in Mirzapur district.

“No incriminating documents were recovered from the house of Mehmood,” SHO Vats said, adding that the UP police returned after executing the warrant of arrest. The SHO, however, clarified that no case was pending against Mehmood in Arwal district.

Authoritative sources said gelatin rods and dynamites were used to blow up the boundary wall of Bright Future Public School in Gonda through remote control system on July 20 last year. “The investigating officers were taken aback by the latest technology used by the terror suspects in the incident,” a member of the visiting UP police team said.

An FIR was lodged on the statement of Shamsher Ahmad, stated to be the founder of the school. Detonator rods, gelatins, electric wire, battery boxes and a bag were seized from the spot.

Title: Gujarat: Three who robbed commuters after faking accident nabbed
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Gang of three who used to rob commuters after faking accidents with their vehicles were nabbed from Lakhota Talav in Jamnagar on Thursday night.

Police said the accused, Manharsinh Jadeja (25), Ahmed Pinjara (28) and Anwar Bhadel (31), used to target lone vehicle drivers.

“During their interrogation, the accused admitted that they targeted lone vehicle drivers and deliberately drove their two-wheelers to cause accidents with them. After this, they would pick up fights with the commuters and rob them of their valuables as compensation for the accidents,” said K K Gohil, sub-inspector with Jamnagar local crime branch.

The police recovered a bike, a cellphone and Rs 10,000 cash from the accused. The accused had robbed 30 commuters in different areas of Jamnagar including Gulabnagar, Talav ni Pal, Dhared GIDC, Theba Chowkadi, Lalpur Chowkadi and Ambar Chowkadi.

“The accused were booked on the complaint of Darshan Vadolia who along with his friend Mahesh was robbed of Rs 200 and a cellphone on the night of January 18. The accused had also allegedly slapped Vadolia,” added Gohil.

Title: JMC councillor’s son among 13 held for gambling
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: As many as 13 people , including the son of Jamnagar Municipal Corporation (JMC) Congress councillor, were arrested after a gambling den was busted in Sachana village on the outskirts of Jamnagar on Thursday night.

Jamnagar local crime branch (LCB) officials received a tip-off that Yusuf Khafi, son of JMC councillor Mariyam Khafi, was running a gambling den at the farmhouse owned by Mariyam.

“Acting on the tip-off, we raided the farmhouse where gambling over playing cards was going on. We arrested 13 people for the crime including Yusuf,” said K K Gohil, sub-inspector with Jamnagar LCB.

The police recovered Rs 3.35 lakh cash, two luxury cars and 16 cellphones, all worth Rs 31.38 lakh, from the accused.

Title: Gujarat: Loan sharks to be booked under PASA, one externed
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Ashish Bhatia

AHMEDABAD: With complaints under The Gujarat Money-Lenders Act pouring in at city police stations over the last month, police officials have decided to invoke the the Prevention of Anti-Social Activities Act ( PASA ) against such offenders.

City police commissioner Ashish Bhatia said police stations have been directed to book loan sharks under PASA, to put a stop to the menace.

“We have to take get tough to stop such elements from running this illegal business and have decided to the step to book them under PASA. We have prepared a list of such elements and strict action will be taken against them,” added Bhatia.

In the first such case, M S Kotwal, the in-charge inspector of Khokhra, on Thursday detained an alleged loan shark, Punamchand Mangaldas Agrawal, 32, a resident of Amraiwadi, booked him under PASA and sent him to Rajkot jail.

This is the first detention of an alleged loan shark under PASA.

The city has been racked by the menace of loan-sharking. In the past month, seven such complaints have been registered at various police stations. Illegal financiers, lending money interest rates up to 40% a month have proliferated.

In some cases, borrowers have committed suicide and others have attempted suicide due to mental and physical harassment by such loan sharks.

In one case, the owner of a furniture showroom in Chandkheda, had borrowed money for his business. He had repaid about twice the principal in eight months, but the compound interest had him in a debt trap.

He wrote a suicide note with the names of the money lenders and killed himself by jumping into the Narmada canal. His motorcycle was found next to the canal in Kadi.

Title: Woman’s body found hanging from tree in Gujarat
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

PALANPUR: Body an unidentified woman was found hanging from a tree in a field located between Hathmati and Bhudeli Rivers under Bhiloda police station limits on Friday.

The field owner Arvind Darji spotted the body at around 12 noon and informed police.

Police inspector NP Chauhan of Bhiloda said the woman was around 35 years old. “We inquired about her relatives in near by villages and her photographs were also displayed. But no one has come forward to claim the body.”

Postmortem has ruled out sexual assault and there were no injury marks on the body. “It looks to be a case of suicide,” added Chauhan.

Title: Muda will open Urwa Market soon
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Mangaluru: The Mangaluru Urban Development Authority (Muda) will open the Urwa Market soon.

At a meeting held at the Muda office, it has been decided to open the new market complex , which was built at a cost of Rs 12.3 crore. With this, the confusion over handing over the building to Mangaluru City Corporation (MCC) comes to an end.

MCC commissioner S Ajith Kumar Hegde said that the building will be opened and managed by the Muda soon. “MCC has decided not to take over the Urwa Market since it has been built by taking a loan of Rs 13 crore. It will be a burden on the MCC. Hence, the Muda has decided to open it, and we will be providing the required logistics,” Hegde said.

Though the market complex at Urwa was inaugurated on January 2019, it still remains closed due to confusion regarding its operation and management. While the then district minister of Dakshina Kannada, B Ramanath Rai, had laid the foundation stone for the market complex in 2016, the building was inaugurated by urban development minister U T Khader on January 27, 2019.

The three-storey market complex of 84,891sqft size was built at Urwa after vacating all shopkeepers three years ago. The new building has a total 122 stalls and a spacious parking area in its basement, with a capacity to park 73 cars and 40 two-wheelers. It has space for 21 fish outlets, stalls for mutton, vegetables, fruits, flowers and premises for other businesses. In addition, the complex also has space for offices and a canteen.

All shopkeepers, who were conducting business at the location, were shifted to a temporary market yard when the project was taken up in December 2016. In fact, it was the MCC’s market, and the same was handed over to Muda for development. The market was inaugurated in January this year. Though the market complex was inaugurated, all the shopkeepers are still continuing their business at the temporary market yard, since the process of auctioning is yet to be taken up.

Title: ‘MSMEs have not applied for upgradation of projects in a decade’
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Surat: State commissioner for micro , small and medium enterprises (MSME), Ranjeeth Kumar J , said the department has not received a single file from MSME entrepreneurs for upgradation of projects in the last one decade.

Speaking at an interactive session on MSME industry organized by Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SGCCI) here on Friday, Ranjeeth Kumar said, “Gujarat has highest number of MSMEs compared to Tamil Nadu. However, MSME department has not received a single proposal from existing MSMEs in Gujarat for upgradation of projects.”

The state government is prepared to resolve the issues faced by MSME sector, but the entrepreneurs lack proper knowledge on various MSME schemes to take maximum benefits, he said.

About existing schemes in MSME sector, Ranjeeth Kumar stated that MSME facilitation council protects the rights of MSMEs. MSME unit owners can directly file complaint in the facilitation centre for disputes regarding non-payment by buyers and get justice within 45 days.

Also, there is credit guarantee trust fund where budding entrepreneurs not having property for mortgage can avail bank loan facility from the state government. Under Baba Saheb Ambedkar Yojana, state government provides 55% subsidy on construction of industrial shed on minimum of two hectares of land.

MK Ladani, general manager of district industries centre (DIC), said, “DIC has forwarded a proposal to the state government to release Rs700 crore worth of fund under various MSME schemes for Surat district till March 2020. This would further give boost to MSME sector in the district.”

SGCCI president Ketan Desai said, “South Gujarat has emerged as MSME hub. There are many MSME units in engineering, chemical, textile, textile ancillary and diamond sectors.”

Title: Dancing is her Durga-inspired cure
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Ever since that fateful July day in 2008, when she first heard the word ‘ carcinoma ’, Ananda Shankar Jayant , rode on her inner strength to fight cancer. In her ‘battle’ with the dreaded disease, the metaphor she relies on is the one of Mahishasuramardhini, of Durga , the fearless one, with 18 arms, riding a lion and the epitome of creative feminine energy.

On Friday evening at Nishagandhi Auditorium here, it was another turn for the renowned Kuchipudi and Bharathanatyam dancer, choreographer and scholar to become one with Simhanandini, the rare piece from the ritualistic repertoire of Kuchipudi revived from an artform of the 13-14th century East Godavari. Drawing the lion with her feet, she was once again making clear and positive affirmations.

The fight with breast cancer was not easy, rather quite difficult. “I felt horrible when I heard of it. I was angry, irritated. I asked my husband whether it’s the end of the road for me. He said no. I somehow pulled myself up with positivity, and my husband supported,” the Padma Shri recipient recalled.

Jayant refused to take a break from dancing even while undergoing cancer treatment. In fact, she called up her friends and relatives to tell them of her ailment. “Look, I am diagnosed with breast cancer. If you feel upset or uncomfortable, please don’t bawl in front of me,” she told them. She had a reason. Usually, people visit the ailing with a long sad face, making the patient more miserable. “I want to tell families, in case a member is going through it, try not to mollycoddle them. Instead, allow them to do what they love to do, which is what my husband did. Even during the chemo, he said, listen to your body. If it says dance, go and dance. I am there to protect and support you. But I will not stop you from doing anything,”

“Your art, your talent or your passion will be your strength. When you nourish it early in life, you will be well prepared to ride out your challenges with greater ease,” Ananda says.

Is this missing in our education? The educators and administrators should now make way for this kind of training, to give the child something to hold on to, be it art, craft or sports. “I became a cancer conqueror only because I was able to focus on my dance. Thanks to my gurus, I have been able to nurture and nourish my passion, because of which I continue,” she said.

This Hyderabad-based IRTS officer has shown to the world how to balance a career and life-long passion so successfully. What next? To upgrade her 40-year-old studio institution into an establishment like Kerala Kalamandalam. It’s her dream. To leave her legacy for the future, where even foreign students can come and learn.

“A space where they can learn mathematics and mridangam together. Many are doing it, but I want to do it in a larger scale,” she adds.

Title: Anti-CAA protesters block Theni MP’s vehicle
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: A group of anti-CAA protesters gheraoed the vehicle of Theni MP O P Ravindranath Kumar in Cumbum late on Thursday night showing their opposition against their MP for voting in favour of the act in the parliament.

According to police sources, Ravindranath Kumar took part in a public meeting organized at Cumbum in connection with MGR’s birthday celebration. A group of protesters, mostly Muslims, had gathered in a road in Cumbum and awaited the MP’s return to show black flags.

Although the police controlled the protesters using barricades, 13 youths jumped over the barricade and blocked the MP’s convoy. As they refused to leave the place and raised slogans against the MP, police forcefully pulled the protesters away from the spot. A police officer said that 43 protesters were shifted to a hall and released later. A case was registered with the Cumbum North police station against the protesters, he said.

In response, a large number of AIADMK cadres took part in road block protests in places like Cumbum, Periyakulam and Bodinayakkanur in Theni district and Vedasandur in Dindigul district. They condemned the behaviour of anti-CAA protesters and demanded stringent action against them. They withdrew the protest after some time.

O R Ravindranath Kumar, in a statement released on Friday strongly condemned the act. “It was a preplanned and deliberate negative campaign by a group of people with vested interests,” he said.

He added that they are trying to create unrest and trigger violence in Theni district. He has also appealed people not to believe false propaganda created by miscreants.

Title: AirAsia ex-director to appear before ED
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Mumbai: Tata Sons said on Friday that its former nominee director on the board of AirAsia India , R Venkataramanan , will appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on February 10 in connection with the money laundering case at the carrier. The agency had issued summons to Venkataramanan for the first time on January 22. “Certain media reported that Venkataramanan had ignored ED summons on three occasions. Such an allegation is factually incorrect. Venkataramanan has not ignored summons from ED or other agency,” said the holding company of the Tata Group in a statement. “Based on due enquiry undertaken by AirAsia India, there has been no wrongdoing by Venkataramanan.” AirAsia India, established in 2013, is a 51:49 joint venture between Tata Sons and Malaysia’s AirAsia.

Title: Noida’s DTH service provider booked in Aligarh for over Rs 400 crore fraud
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

AGRA: Aligarh police has registered an FIR against 13 persons from a Noida-based DTH service firm, Independent TV , in connection with an alleged fraud of over Rs 400 crore by not providing services to their 15 lakh customers across the nation even after taking payment.

One of the 60 zonal distributors, Chetan Dixit in Aligarh had lodged a police complaint against 13 persons, including five directors of the company, for allegedly not providing services to around 50,000 customers in Aligarh zone since June 2019. The operator was acquired by Pantel Technologies Pvt Ltd. He also alleged that they made an attempt to kill him when he had demanded his money back.

All of the suspects have been booked under sections 307 (attempt to murder), 420 (cheating), 406 (criminal breach of trust), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of IPC at Kawarsi police station.

Dixit claimed that when he contacted the company’s office bearers, they assured to re-start the services but later they stopped even responding to his calls and emails.

“When I went to meet them in their Noida office, they abused and misbehaved with me,” said Dixit, adding that they even threatened to kill him. He told TOI that he had made a payment of Rs 80 lakh, including Rs 15 lakh cash, to them.

The complainant stated in the FIR that the digital service provider had launched their services in August 2018 and their first office was located in H Block, Sector 63, which was later shifted to some other location in the same sector without informing the distributors in April 2019.

According to the Aligarh-based distributor, their customers, who had paid Rs 2,250 per connection for subscribing to the services, started facing problems after the service provider had stopped broadcasting many channels in February 2019. He alleged that they completely stopped broadcasting from June 2019, due to nonpayment to the channels subscribed for the viewers.

Independent TV was originally launched as Reliance Big TV on August 19, 2008. The service acquired 1 million subscribers within 90 days of launch, due to limited competition from other operators in the market. The service was later renamed to Reliance Digital TV . The operator was acquired by Pantel Technologies & Veecon Media in January 2018. In March 2018, the company launched a pre-booking DTH offer. The company took bookings and collected revenue from customers, but the connections were not installed.

After launching the DTH offer, the Pantel Technologies & Veecon Media group rebranded the company as Independent TV.

The company was unable to provide installation to customers, as their agreement with Star India group had expired due to nonpayment. On July 23, 2018, Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal (TDSAT) requested Star India and Independent TV to enter into a fresh agreement within 4 weeks. The company’s services were disrupted after further payments to the Antrix Corporation were missed. Independent TV closed its services on June 12, 2019.

Title: Mobile snatcher shot dead in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Two men shot at the mobile snatcher at point-blank range

SURAT: A mobile snatcher was shot dead at point blank range by unidentified persons riding a motorcycle in Pandesara area of the city on Friday. Deceased was identified as Sachin Dinashankar Mishra, 20. He was caught for mobile snatching and lodged in Lajpore Central Jail until his release a few days ago.

Unidentified assailants on a motorcycle stopped him on Tere Naam Road of Pandesara and fired two rounds at him from a pistol at around 8.30pm. The assailants escaped from the spot. Police reached the spot and started investigation but refused to say anything on the issue. Police sources said the murder was result of personal enmity.

Title: 112-year-old wooden house gutted in fire, no casualties
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

The gutted house was owned by Anita Javerbhai Mavani and Vanmalidas Manekchand

SURAT: A 112-year-old wooden house on Darukhana Road in Galemandi area of Begumpura area of the city was gutted on Friday evening. Doors and windows of two adjacent houses also caught fire and six people from these houses were brought out safely.

Fire officials said as they started to spray water to douse the fire which had engulfed the ground floor, its first floor collapsed. The house is owned by Anita Javerbhai Mavani and Vanmalidas Manekchand and other family members. Only a woman was in the house when the fire started. She ran out before the fire could spread. The other four members of the family, who live in this house, were out. There were no casualties . The cause of fire is not known.

These types of constructions are about 60 feet long and 20 feet wide and there is no space between two walls. A large crowd at the spot alleged that the fire department took half an hour to reach the spot. One of the neighbours, angry with fire officials, was taken away by people.

Title: Rs 59,800 realized as fine, illegal structures razed in Patna
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: More than 15 temporary structures and 19 huts in the city were razed and penalty to the tune of Rs59,800 was collected as the three-day anti-encroachment drive concluded on Friday.

The district administration, Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Patna police conducted the drive in Bankipore, New Capital Circle (NCC) and Pataliputra Circle . PMC officials said Rs30,000 was collected as fine from offenders on Friday.

The authorities razed parts of 10 illegal shops, which had encroached the road in front of their outlets between Rajiv Nagar drain and Ashiana Mor. “Twelve small lorries were seized from Rajiv Nagar area and a total fine of Rs13,500 was collected from owners of illegal structures in the Patliputra circle on Friday,” said Manish Kumar, executive officer of Patliputra circle.

In the Bankipore circle, five huts were removed and two lorries were seized around Patna civil court, BN College road, Daldali road and Kadamkuan.

Besides, several illegal encroachments were removed and three tricycle carts were seized in NCC. “A fine of Rs16,500 was collected from the offenders in NCC circle but no FIR was lodged against them,” said Shailesh Kumar, EO of NCC.

Divisional commissioner Sanjay Kumar Agarwal said several encroached roads will be widened soon. “Widening of Ashiana- Digha road is underway. Thereafter, traffic lights will be removed from the area,” he said.

Meanwhile, Patna district magistrate Kumar Ravi instructed PMC and police officers to keep a strict vigil in the areas from where encroachments have been removed. “Local police stations, traffic police and PMC have been instructed to make sure that the roads are not encroached again,” he said.

Title: Patna: Parties trade barbs on Karpoori Thakur birth anniversary
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav with senior party functionaries at birth anniversary celebration of former Bihar CM Karp... Read More

PATNA: The 96th birth anniversary celebration of former CM and extremely backward caste (EBC) leader Karpoori Thakur by Rashtriya Lok Samata Party (RLSP) was a low-key affair on Friday. The BJP, on the other hand, chose the occasion to criticise the Congress and RJD for “neglecting” EBC sections as far as job quota is concerned.

RLSP chief Upendra Kushwaha led his party’s ‘maanav kataar’, which was formed by students on the Miller School ground here. However, barring the Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP) chief Mukesh Sahni, other Grand Alliance functionaries were conspicuous by their absence at the event. “These parties had their separate programmes to celebrate the day. There is no rift in the Grand Alliance,” Kushwaha said.

Meanwhile, senior BJP functionaries reminded the EBC sections of the way the Congress and RJD “neglected” their job quota interests. State BJP president Dr Sanjay Kumar Jaiswal, deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi , several ministers and MLAs also addressed the gathering.

Modi said the RJD has only three MLAs from the EBC sections compared to 12 from the BJP.

“The BJP and JD(U) together have seven Lok Sabha MPs from EBC,” the deputy CM added.

Title: SC to club Tatas’ NCLAT plea, RoC-Mumbai case
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: The Supreme Court on Friday issued a notice on a plea filed by Tata Sons, challenging a January 6 order by the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). The appellate tribunal had rejected an application by the Registrar of Companies-Mumbai (RoC-Mumbai) seeking removal of certain observations made in connection with the conversion of Tata Sons from a deemed public limited company into a private entity.

An SC bench, comprising Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant, issued the notice to the parties concerned. It also said it will hear the matter along with Tata Sons’ main appeal filed against the December 18 NCLAT order that reinstated Cyrus Mistry as the chairman of the company.

It may be noted that the Supreme Court on January 10 had stayed the operation of the December 18 NCLAT verdict. Following that verdict, the RoC-Mumbai had filed an application as it found certain strictures passed by the appellate tribunal against its statutory actions unwarranted. The RoC also said these were against the principles of natural justice that require the concerned party be given an opportunity of being heard before a judgment is passed against it.

The December 18 judgment stated that the Tata Sons conversion was done in a hurried manner with the help of RoC-Mumbai, whose action was illegal.

RoC-Mumbai wanted phrases like “with the help of RoC-Mumbai” and “illegal” to be deleted from the 172-page judgment.

The NCLAT later clarified that the hurry in the judgment was referred to be on the part of Tata Sons and its board of directors to change its status and “nothing has been alleged against RoC-Mumbai”. It said that it is its finding in the judgment that the action taken by the RoC was “prejudicial“ and “oppressive” to the minority shareholders of Tata Sons, specifically to Cyrus Mistry and his family. It added “no specific mala fide action has been alleged against RoC-Mumbai”. The NCLAT then dismissed RoC-Mumbai’s application.

Title: Bajaj to ride with Triumph, 1st bike in 2022
Content:
(Representative image)

PUNE: Bajaj Auto said it will bring out the first of the Triumph Motorcycles in 2022, as the two companies announced their non-equity partnership, the first such globally for the UK-based premium bike maker.To take a larger share in a market where it sold just about 850 motorcycles in 2019, Triumph said the bike, built exclusively under the partnership, will address the missing mid-range in its portfolio and will retail at a price starting at Rs 2 lakh.“The partnership will build a new engine and vehicle platform in the mid-capacity range (200-750 cc) and offer multiple options to address different segment in this class,” the two companies said in a joint statement.At a later date, the companies said Bajaj Auto will also take over Triumph’s Indian distribution activities and also set up dealerships in the markets where Triumph is not present. Triumph will also sell the India-made motorcycles through its dealerships in the markets where it has a presence.Rajiv Bajaj, managing director, Bajaj Auto, said the seeds of the partnership were sown in 2006, when his company approached Triumph but it was only in 2016 when the Triumph got back to Bajaj Auto.“John Bloor (founder of Triumph Motorcycles) kept saying that when we are ready, we will come back to you...and in November 2016, we got a call from them saying, now we are ready. We are calling on you first. Let us do something together,” said Bajaj.The two companies have since put together a team to work on the design, the brand positioning and other intricacies of the deal.For Triumph, the partnership was a step towards entering new global markets (where Bajaj Auto also exports its indigenous motorcycles) and attract a younger customer base in India and Southeast Asia, among other geographies.“Businesses go through phases and when we evaluated, this was the next step towards finding a new customer base and finding more growth opportunities,” said Nick Bloor, CEO, Triumph Motorcycles.The vehicles will be manufactured at Bajaj Auto’s Chakan plant in Pune, which has a monthly capacity of about 1 lakh motorcycles. Bajaj Auto has earlier tied up with Austria’s KTM and Japan’s Kawasaki.

Title: Bajaj to ride with Triumph, 1st bike in 2022
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

(Representative image)

PUNE: Bajaj Auto said it will bring out the first of the Triumph Motorcycles in 2022, as the two companies announced their non-equity partnership, the first such globally for the UK-based premium bike maker.

To take a larger share in a market where it sold just about 850 motorcycles in 2019, Triumph said the bike, built exclusively under the partnership, will address the missing mid-range in its portfolio and will retail at a price starting at Rs 2 lakh.

“The partnership will build a new engine and vehicle platform in the mid-capacity range (200-750 cc) and offer multiple options to address different segment in this class,” the two companies said in a joint statement.

At a later date, the companies said Bajaj Auto will also take over Triumph’s Indian distribution activities and also set up dealerships in the markets where Triumph is not present. Triumph will also sell the India-made motorcycles through its dealerships in the markets where it has a presence.

Rajiv Bajaj, managing director, Bajaj Auto, said the seeds of the partnership were sown in 2006, when his company approached Triumph but it was only in 2016 when the Triumph got back to Bajaj Auto.

“John Bloor (founder of Triumph Motorcycles) kept saying that when we are ready, we will come back to you...and in November 2016, we got a call from them saying, now we are ready. We are calling on you first. Let us do something together,” said Bajaj.

The two companies have since put together a team to work on the design, the brand positioning and other intricacies of the deal.

For Triumph, the partnership was a step towards entering new global markets (where Bajaj Auto also exports its indigenous motorcycles) and attract a younger customer base in India and Southeast Asia, among other geographies.

“Businesses go through phases and when we evaluated, this was the next step towards finding a new customer base and finding more growth opportunities,” said Nick Bloor, CEO, Triumph Motorcycles.

The vehicles will be manufactured at Bajaj Auto’s Chakan plant in Pune, which has a monthly capacity of about 1 lakh motorcycles. Bajaj Auto has earlier tied up with Austria’s KTM and Japan’s Kawasaki.

Title: SP MLA Nahid Hasan arrested, sent to jail in cheating case
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: Samajwadi Party MLA from Kairana, Nahid Hasan, was on Friday arrested and sent to jail after a local court rejected his bail plea in connection with a cheating case filed against him last year. The MLA was booked on January 17 last year after a local, Mohammad Ali, filed a case alleging that he was cheated of Rs 80 lakh by Hasan in a land deal.

Hasan was booked under section 420 (cheating) of Indian Penal Code at Kairana police station. His lawyer Intezar Ali said, “Hasan had nothing to do with this case. We will approach high court for bail soon.”

This is not the only case that MLA Hasan is facing. His trouble started on September 9 last year after a public spat with Kairana’s sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) Amit Pal Sharma when the officer stopped his SUV and asked for its papers. Later, during a probe, it turned out that the vehicle was not registered at all. Hasan was then booked for allegedly misbehaving with the government servant and driving an SUV without valid papers.

Later, district administration and police in Shamli, under which Kairana town falls, decided to dust off 11 old cases filed against the MLA and expedited probe in all of them.

Title: Surat bags overall best smart city award
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Surat: Surat city bagged the best overall smart city award from among the 100 cities at the third apex conference of smart cities held at Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh on Friday. Surat also received awards in two more categories.

The union ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) had organized the Indian Smart city awards 2019 where cities were rated according to their performance.

Surat received the award for its projects like speedy implementation of SMAC Centre, Intelligent Transit Management System (ITMS), smart solid waste management system, AIC SURATi iLab foundation, visual improvements on model roads, solar and wind power generation and affordable housing to name a few.

The Diamond City received two more awards for restoration re-use and re-development of Surat castle in culture and economy category and One City One Card-Digitalization for cashless travel by integration of Automatic Fare Collection System with Surat Money Card under the Mobility and Transportation category.

These awards was received by Surat mayor Dr Jagdish Patel and municipal commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani from secretary Durga Shankar Mishra.

Title: Nothing wrong in Rajini’s statement: Pon
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: BJP leader Pon Radhakrishnan has come to the defence of Rajinikanth by stating “Rajinikanth did not utter a word that is defaming Periyar,” adding that some political parties are inclined to play politics around the actor. Radhakrishnan was interacting with reporters at Tiruchendur in Tuticorin on Friday.

Recalling that he was at the event and also listened to the speech many times later, he felt there was nothing wrong in it but expected issues to be raised on two or three points. He said Rajinikanth only spoke highly about a magazine at the event organised by the magazine and the argument over his speech was unnecessary.

“I am surprised that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is ‘imposing’ Tamil in Delhi and the United Nations. This is contrary to the previous governments that tried to impose Hindi in Tamil Nadu. Should we condemn the imposition of Tamil in the international arena?” he asked in response to Dravida Kazhagam leader Veeramani’s allegation that Sanskrit is imposed by the Centre.

Radhakrishnan said there was nothing wrong in every party preparing themselves to fight the assembly polls independently as BJP has grown to a stature wherein only the party that has an alliance with them will form the government in Tamil Nadu in 2021. “BJP does not have the thought of leaving the AIADMK alliance,” he said in response to controversies on the alliance raised by a few AIADMK ministers.

About the delay in appointing a state president for the party in Tamil Nadu – a vacancy for nearly five months – he said that it is due to the concern of the BJP headquarters on its Tamil Nadu unit. “Not only in Tamil Nadu, but state presidents (of the party) are yet to be appointed in a few other states like Kerala, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. State presidents have been elected only in 21 States,” he said. Meanwhile, information and publicity minister Kadambur C Raju told reporters in Tuticorin that the state government will not remain a mute spectator to disturbance to law and order over the Rajinikanth – Periyar row. “We will take strong action,” he said. TNN

Title: Renacon opens new unitat SIPCOT in Tirunelveli
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Chennai: Erode-based Renacon AAC blocks manufacturer - Renaatus Procon Pvt Ltd has invested Rs 50 crore in a new plant at SIPCOT in Tirunelveli.

P Selvasundram, chairman and managing director of Renaatus Procon said, “We aim to generate a direct employment to over 300 employees with this new plant launch.” AAC Block is a viable alternative to conventional block, which is largely used for major projects like Chennai Metro and Chennai Airport.

With this plant expansion the company said to aim to help the construction industry to surpass the present crisis of sand and red bricks shortage.

This is the company’s second plant at Tirunelveli in Tamil Nadu, after Arcot, besides depots in Chennai and Coimbatore. It also has distributor base across Tamil Nadu and Kerala.

Title: Patna: Parked trucks hit traffic on Digha-Danapur canal road
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Illegally parked trucks on Digha-Danapur canal road on Friday

PATNA: Commuters and residents find it difficult to pass through the two-lane road along the Digha-Danapur canal owing to long queues of trucks parked on the road.

The12.27km-long road underneath the Digha-AIIMS elevated road connects the southern and northern parts of the city along the western outskirts. Similar is the problem in other areas like Phulwarisharif and Naubatpur as well.

Agitated over the frequent snarls and disturbed vehicular movement, commuters claim that the authorities should not allow parking of heavy vehicles on main roads. They further said the alternative routes are either blocked or in very bad condition.

“Traffic snarls during morning hours on roads leading to JP Setu, Digha and other areas of the city have become a daily phenomenon. Trucks have been parked on Khagaul canal road for the last two days. The authorities haven’t done anything despite knowing about it,” said Manoj Tiwari, a resident of Mustafapur.

Vikash from Ekma in Saran district said: “I was stuck on Khagaul canal road for more than one and a half hours on Thursday morning. The vehicles were moving at a snail’s pace.”

Meanwhile, schoolchildren are also having a tough time in reaching home due to slow traffic movement in the area. “My school’s dispersal time is 2pm. It takes me an hour to reach home but now it is taking more than one and a half hours,” said Ananya of Chanakya Puri.

Vivek Sharma, who drives a private school bus in Digha area said: “Khagaul Nahar road, which is the easiest route for going to Anisabad, remains chock-a-block throughout the day. I have started taking different routes now.”

Meanwhile, senior traffic police officers said truck drivers park their vehicles in Phulwarisharif, Khagaul and Danapur areas because of unavailability of parking heavy commercial vehicles in other parts of the city.

“Chhapra-bound heavy vehicles get stuck in the city due to several reasons, including dense fog. The truck drivers fear accidents while travelling in low visibility due to foggy conditions in the early morning hours, because of which they park their vehicles in areas like Phulwarisharif and Khagaul-Danapur Canal road,” a senior Patna traffic policeman officer said.

He added: “Regular monitoring takes place on all such roads. Police officers have also been deputed to ensure hassle-free vehicular movement. Besides, trucks are parked in only one lane of the road.”

Title: West Bengal: Newborn falls ill as eunuchs forcibly dance with him, dies
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

The eunuchs who were arrested on Friday

JHARGRAM: Three eunuchs were arrested after one of twin baby boys they forcibly danced with died soon after at Jhargram hospital on Friday. Villagers in Radhanagar — in Jhargram’s Silda — held them captive after the 50-day-old child, Suman, fell ill when the eunuchs were dancing with him. As Suman showed signs of collapsing, his father Chandan Khilar rushed the baby to Silda Hospital, which referred him to Jhargram Hospital, where the infant died.

The arrested trio — Rumala Mondal, Suhana Mondal and Rani Mondal — had knocked on Khilar’s house around 9.30am. Khilar’s wife Tanima had delivered the twins on December 4 and they had been at the local hospital’s neonatal care unit for a month. The family had brought the boys home just 20 days ago.

Khilar, a driver, said, “The three eunuchs got wind that we had infants in our house and knocked on our door on Friday morning. They demanded Rs 12,000 and wanted to dance with our twins. I told them I could not afford the money they were demanding. After a lot of negotiation, we agreed on Rs 2,000. I requested them to take the money and leave without dancing with our babies. But they insisted. While they were dancing, Suman fell very ill. I rushed him to our local hospital where doctors advised we take him to Jhargram Hospital. Suman passed away soon after.”

Khilar then lodged a police complaint.

His neighbours in Radhanagar had caught the three eunuchs after Khilar left for the hospital and they later turned them over to a team of officers that arrived in the village.

Jhargram SP Amit Kumar Bharat Rathore said, “We are investigating the complaint of the deceased child’s father. We have arrested the trio whom the father has accused in his complaint. They all belong to the third gender.”

Title: Ruckus at parking lot near Howrah station
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

HOWRAH: Operators of an illegal parking lot on Bankim Road opposite Howrah station ’s new complex allegedly attacked staffers of an authorised one on Friday morning after the latter refused to pay them Rs 50,000. The cash counter of the authorised parking lot was damaged and Rs 2.3 lakh was looted from it along with the parking register. Rohit Singh, an employee of the authorised parking lot, sustained a serious head injury and had to be admitted to a hospital.

Ritesh Pandey, who runs the authorised parking lot on KoPT land, alleged that miscreants running the unauthorised lot regularly extort money from him. “On Friday, a group of 10 local youths demanded Rs 50,000. When we refused, they attacked us. We have often complained, but cops have not acted against them,” said Pandey.

A Howrah officer said, “We are probing the complaint by Pandey and will look into why no action was taken earlier.”

Title: Speed trials held on converted railway line to Usilampatti
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: Speed trials were conducted on the newly converted broad gauge railway line between Madurai and Usilampatti stations on Wednesday. Commissioner of railway safety, southern circle, Bengaluru, K A Manoharan, inspected the tracks on Tuesday and the speed trial on Wednesday.

Trials were conducted on the 37km stretch which was inspected over two days. Rail services would begin on this track following certification from the commissioner.

Meanwhile, villagers of Alampatti on the Madurai Usilampatti route staged a protest near the track on Wednesday morning demanding a road to their village across the track. They said that as there was no gate or road, their village was getting disconnected and that they would find it difficult to go to the other side of the road.

Madurai MP Su Venkatesan has said that Madurai division DRM V R Lenin has assured him that train services on the line would begin in about four months on this route.

Since Dec 31, 2010, Madurai-Bodi train services were suspended for gauge conversion works.

Title: Abhayam helps woman perform widowhood rituals
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

VADODARA: The marriage of this woman from Shehra taluka of Panchmahal district to an army man from Navi Vadi in 2014 turned out to be a chapter in harassment and ignominy.

Not only did the in-laws harass her out of their house, but also made the woman suffer the pain of being widowed in isolation. They didn’t even inform Kanta Valand, who now stays at her parental home at Ujda village for the past one year, about the death of her husband Kamlesh Valand.

Such was their animosity that her kin had to approach the Abhayam women helpline to ensure that the ritual of breaking her bangles after her husband’s death could be performed.
