Deceased Kamlesh used to work with the army and visited home only during holidays. According to Abhayam members, Kamlesh had died on January 17 after a brief illness. His last rites were performed on the next day.

According to an Abhayam member, they had reached out to Kamlesh’s family asking them to ensure that the widowhood ritual of breaking Kanta’s bangles was performed. “When we reached the place, the atmosphere was tense. We had to call Shehra police to ensure that no untoward incident took place,” said a member of the team that accompanied Kanta to Navi Vadi village for the ritual.

It was high drama when the ritual could be performed in the presence of large number of people. But soon after it was over, the team from Abhayam, along with the police left the place swiftly to avoid further friction.

Abhayam team however assured Kanta that her rights as the widow of Kamlesh would not be affected and she would get her dues.

Title: Thousands brave cold at Kashi ghats for Mauni Amavasya snan
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Varanasi: Thousands of devotees took holy dip in the Ganga on the auspicious occasion of Mauni Amavasya on Friday. Devotees, braving cold, started thronging the ghats from early morning hours. Important ghats including Dashashwmedh ghat, Panchaganga Ghat, Tulsi Ghat, Kedar Ghat, Assi Ghat witnessed huge gathering of devotees performing religious rituals on the auspicious day. In view of the large gathering of devotees, traffic restrictions were imposed on the roads leading to the ghats. Besides, parking arrangements were also made at different points including Company Bagh, Townhall, Sanatan Dharm Inter College.

Title: Six years on, city to get its own blood separation unit, new signals
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Kolhapur: The district planning and development council on Friday decided to grant funds to develop blood separation unit in Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) limits.

The proposal seeking Rs 2 crore was pending for last six years and several assurances were made to the KMC regarding the funds. Now, the DPDC has decided to provide all the funds for the unit under the ‘innovative schemes’ category of its budget.

After a meeting of the DPDC no Friday, district guardian minister Satej Patil announced that the funds would be granted to the blood separation unit. The unit is expected to come up Firangai Talim area of the city. When the project was proposed, the KMC had sanctioned Rs 50 lakh through its own budget. However; just the civil works were carried out through the funds and the machineries were not procured and staff was not hired.

“As the cases of the vector-borne diseases such as dengue are increasing, the demand for blood components such as white blood cells and plasma is rising. Mostly, poor patients admitted in the civic hospitals cannot afford the blood components required for the treatment of such diseases. Once the unit is set up, we will be able to provide the blood components to such and other critical patients immediately,” said a senior KMC official, requesting anonymity.

At present, there are several blood banks in the city but only a handful of them have the facility of blood component separation. The modern equipment required for the separation of the blood components is costly. The KMC’s blood bank is located in the Firangai Talim dispensary itself. The preservation centre will also be developed at the separation unit.

The DPDC has approved an estimate of Rs 581 crore for the next financial year. The other works to be taken through the DPDC budget include — developing facilities for the visitors at Mahalaxmi temple, provide water bottles to the students, install fire-fighting systems in several places and install traffic signalling system in the city.

Title: Ashram trust airs concerns about plan
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

AHMEDABAD: For the first time, the six trustees of the Sabarmati Ashram Preservation and Memorial Trust (SAPMT) have come out to claim that the trust, “has not received any official intimation of the said plan (re-development of Sabarmati Gandhi Ashram premises) so far.”

-A detailed letter from them airing their concerns has claimed that the “suggested (redevelopment) plan of the government required thoughtful conservation of many issues such as autonomy and mandate of different trusts, consensus of Ashram residents and preservation of the sanctity of the place keeping in mind the values and ethos of Gandhiji.”

The trustees include, SEWA founder Ela Bhatt, CEE Founder Kartikeya Sarabhai, Gandhi heritage committee chairman Sudershan Iyengar, former honorary president of the Crafts Council of India, Ashoke Chaterjee, and former MD Hazira LNG and Port Companies, Nitin Shukla. They have issued a public statement in this regard. The trustees have claimed that they had been invited to participate in the discussions without providing them a copy of the plan. Earlier on Friday morning, Ashram residents protested against the government’s redevelopment plan.

The trustees have said that the, “lack of formal communication with residents (of Ashram) has created anxiety , concerns and misunderstanding at many levels.” There are six trusts that operate from the Gandhi Ashram complex , which include the Gujarat Harijan Sevak Sangh, Sabarmati Harijan Ashram Trust, Gujarat Khadi-Gramudyog Mandal, Khadi Gramudyog Prayog Samiti and SAPMT. The trustees have said that they are “keenly concerned about all these challenges and that these will be met with open dialogue and mutual trust among all the different stake-holders.”

Title: Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatnana threatens to shut sugar factories
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatnana (SSS) has threatened to shut down sugar mills in the district if cane in the flood-affected areas is not cut before January end.

SSS delegation led by its state president Jaindar Patil met district collector Daulat Desai and pointed out that sugar factories were not following his directive to cut sugar cane in flood-affected areas on priority basis.

Patil said that the delay in cutting sugar cane in the flood-affected areas was badly affecting its recovery, resulting in financial losses. He told Desai that the farmers in the district faced severe crisis, especially during floods and unseasonal rain at a time when government schemes were not implemented for them.

Soon after, Desai contacted officials of sugar commissionerate to address the problem. Sugar commissioner office said that a meeting of all stakeholders would be held next week to address the issue. Desai promised the delegation that sugar factories which failed to comply with the directives will face legal action.

In November last year, the collector had issued an order stating that the cane cutting exercise in flood-affected areas should be given priority and that the activity must be completed by January 21. However, farmers have been complaining that their cane still lies in the fields without being cut.

Majority of the cane growing talukas were badly hit during floods last year as the standing crop was completely submerged underwater for more than a month.

Title: UP man blames doctor for son’s death, asks CM to order probe
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath

BAREILLY: The father of a biker who allegedly died in a road accident has written to Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath , requesting him to order a probe into the circumstances of his son’s death.

The deceased’s father, Pintu Rastogi, claimed that his son, Deepu (25), was alive two hours after doctors had declared him “dead”. He claimed he went to the mortuary and found his son was breathing. Precious time was wasted by government hospital doctors in failing to diagnose his son’s condition and he died on way to a private hospital. He accused the emergency medical officer on duty at the district hospital of negligence, resulting in his son’s death. The CMO has denied the allegations leveled by the man.

Speaking with TOI, Rastogi said his son used to run a confectionary shop in Sheeshgarh town and met with an accident on Baigul bridge. “He was brought to hospital by Dial 112 team but the doctor on duty did not even bother to remove his helmet to check his condition,” he alleged. The bereaved man claimed that the doctor concerned declared him “brought dead on a junior’s advice”.

It took Rastogi two hours to reach the hospital. He went to the mortuary. “I found that my son was alive and all the staff in the hospital also witnessed the same. The doctor wasted crucial two hours and even kept my son in the freezer, which led to his death. I have shot videos of the entire incident and have lodged a complaint with the CM, local police and DM. I am waiting for their response.”

Chief medical officer, Bareilly , Vineet Shukla told TOI, “We are yet to receive any official complaint from the deceased’s father and will take appropriate action on the basis of evidence. However, I had conducted a preliminary investigation in this case earlier but didn’t find any truth in the allegations leveled by the man. The patient was brought dead to hospital.”

When TOI contacted SP (crime) RK Bhartiya, he said, “Police can file an FIR against the government doctor when a probe is completed by a panel of doctors and they recommend action against the doctor on duty. Since the complaint is out of our jurisdiction, we advised him to contact the health department and complain there.”

Title: Republic Day 2020 Delhi: Anti-CAA protests in mind, Republic Day security heightened
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

A team of sharpshooters from NSG along with spotters will be positioned on all the highrises around Rajpath to... Read More

NEW DELHI: An extra layer of security will be in place around Rajpath to frisk visitors on Republic Day after police received military intelligence inputs that protesters, wearing clothes that carry anti-CAA messages , could attempt to enter the enclosures. If required, a strip search of “suspicious” visitors could be conducted, police said.

For the first time, Delhi Police will launch its mobile police control room (PCR) van that will be stationed at Rajpath to ensure seamless communication with other agencies.

Facial recognition cameras have been installed about a kilometre away, and will watch all arterial roads leading to Rajpath. Apart from an anti-drone alert, the flying of paragliders, hot-air balloons and remotely piloted aircraft has been prohibited.

A team of sharpshooters from the National Security Guard along with spotters will be positioned on all highrises around Rajpath to scan the crowd, while two Indian Army light helicopters will carry snipers. An additional 48 companies of paramilitary forces will help the nearly 22,000 personnel of Delhi Police. Two anti-terror and crime control vans — named Parakram and Prakhar — will also be deployed along the parade route.

“Apart from securing the main venue at Rajpath, adequate security and traffic arrangements for the ‘At Home’ function at Rashtrapati Bhavan have been made. A city-wide alert is also being exercised by all district DCPs,” said police spokesperson Mandeep Randhawa.

Security will also be tightened around popular markets, malls and other crowded places. Delhi Police said tenant verification had been taken up extensively in the city. The borders have been secured and regular coordination is being maintained with police of the neighbouring states.

“Surprise checks will be carried out by placing barricades at various places. India Gate and other places of tourist interest will be kept secure in view of visitor rush,” said Eish Singh, DCP (New Delhi).

All arterial roads in Lutyens’ Delhi will be access-controlled through colour stickers provided for the vehicles and the visitors. Over 2,000 traffic cops have already been deployed. The entry to the venue will be restricted after 8am on Sunday.

Title: Bose’s grandson pays tributes to Bismil in Gorakhpur
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Gorakhpur: Grandson of Subhashchandra Bose and national president of NAMO Sena, Somnath Bose, on Friday, visited Gorakhpur district jail and garlanded the statue of Pt Ram Prasad Bismil there. He also paid floral tributes at Bismil memorial and the place where he was hanged on December 19, 1927.

During his address as chief guest at Bismil Fair and Sports fest organized under the aegis of Gurukripa Sansthan, he said, “From next year, family of martyrs and freedom fighters will also be associated with the fair and I’ll be present here.”

On CAA and NRC, he said, “Democracy gives right to protest and government should also listen to the protesters. I am sure that PM Modi will find a solution of the protest.”

On Gumnami Baba, he said, “Neta Ji could never be Gumnami. The DNA test was negative for four times.” BJP leader Brijesh Tripathi and SP jail Ramdhani were present on the occasion. tnn

Title: RBSE board exam: 210 new centres to come up
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Ajmer: The Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) will set up 210 new examination centres for board examination this year. With this total number of centres will be 5,680.

RBSE secretary Meghna Choudhary said that these new centres are opened to keep in view that students should not travel long distance to reach the centre. The board has discussed with education officers of each district to see that examination centres should be within the reach of students. The board found that there are 210 more examination centres required in the state and therefore these new centres are sanctioned by the board, Choudhary said.

Among the new centres, maximum will be set up in Badmer 22, followed by Jodhpur 16, Bikaner 15, Alwar and Jalore 14 each, Ajmer 10, Dausa nine, Jhunjhunu eight, Pali seven, Jaipur, Jaisalmer, Jhalawar, Sikar and Udaipur six each, Bhilwara, Nagaur, Partapgarh and Hanumangarh five each, Dholpur and Karauli four each, Tonk, Bundi three each, Banswara, Dungerpur and Baran two each, while Chittorgarh, Sirohi, Shri Ganganager and Rajasmand one each. The highest number of centres will be in Jaipur district with 556 and lowest will be in Ajmer with 178. The senior secondary board examination in state will start from March 5 whereas secondary board exams will start from March 12.

Title: Hearing & speech impaired students stage protest in city
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: Hundreds of hearing and speech impaired students of Government College Poddar , Jaipur staged a protest in front of the college gates on Friday against the lack of facilities in the college.

The protest started at 9.30am and went on for the entire day, wherein the students made their stand clear using sign language to the authorities who had come to persuade them to end the protest.

Vijay Meena, one of the protesting students, through an interpreter conveyed, “ There are only two interpreters in the college on contract. Earlier, our teachers were given special training to teach regular students and differently able in the class. They have been now transferred and teachers without training are teaching us. We want them to be transferred back.” Government College Poddar gives admission to differently able students, who are taught along with other students. A total of 350 differently able students are studying in the college, for whom there are three teachers without any training to deal with the differently able students.

Title: Sivan attributes his success to hard work
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Isro chairman K Sivan said that hard work never fails and there is no short cut to success. He was speaking after receiving the Sree Chithira Thirunal National Award instituted by Sree Chithira Thirunal Trust in the function held in the city on Friday.

Governor Arif Mohammad Khan presented the award comprising a cash prize of Rs 3 lakh and citation.

“It is not just my sole effort that has brought me here. I would like to thank my parents, teachers and Isro colleagues who have shaped me as a person as well as my career. I received my education from government schools in Tamil medium and government colleges. I have faced numerous challenges in my career. In my younger days, I learned about rocket science in PSLV project under the guidance of G Madhavan Nair. Even though Isro had a humble beginning, today we have realised the vision of Dr Vikram Sarabhai,” said Sivan.

On future projects of Isro, he said, “Our aim is to have the first unmanned flight by the end of this year. A series of tests are planned in 2020 to validate the design and engineering of this system. Land acquisition for about 2,300 acres in Tuticorin for a new launch pad is in progress.”

Governor Khan in his address urged people to be curios like children.

Title: Cane farmers slam invite for Brazil Prez as R-Day guest
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: Tamil Nadu Sugarcane Farmers Association has condemned the participation of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro as chief guest at the Republic Day celebrations in New Delhi. Association state president N Palanisamy, Tamil Nadu farmers association secretary K Rajendran and others said Brazil had complained to World Trade Organisation (WTO) against the facilities and subsidies being provided to sugarcane farmers in India. Hence the invitation extended to Bolsonaro has caused anguish to them.

The farmers’ leaders said Brazil cited WTO rules to show that the Indian government was extending many facilities in violation of them. This has caused concern among sugarcane farmers in India. ``If WTO takes a stand in support of Brazil, India will have to change its trade rules which would affect farmers more,’’ Palanisamy said. At a time when sugarcane farmers countrywide are seeking more subsidies, they feared that the Brazilian government’s move may rob them of the existing subsidies.

They alleged that like Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Bolsonaro too was a supporter of corporate firms and had opened the doors to them to rob the resources in the Amazon forests. Sugarcane farmers throughout the country would conduct a protest against Bolsonaro’s visit. In Madurai, they have decided to stage a demonstration in front of the Alanganallur sugar mill against Jair Bolsonaro’s visit and also demanding their pending dues to the tune of nearly Rs 20 crore.

Title: Man seeking fuel station franchise duped
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: An insurance agent on Thursday filed a complaint with the Sector 21 police station in Gandhinagar stating that he has been duped of Rs 120,500 through online transactions by two fraudsters. The complainant was apparently targeted while he attempted to secure a franchise of a fuel retail station from a large company, according to the FIR.

Kirtikumar Mehta, 56, a resident of Vastunirman Society in Gandhinagar’s Sector 22 and a native of Santalpur in Patan, stated in his complaint that on December 26, 2019, he had sent a request on the website of “Essar Petroleum” to set up a petrol pump at his native place. The two fraudsters allegedly stole the details online and falsely claimed that they were the executives of the company.

“Mehta had filled up an online form on a website and has added his email address,” the FIR said. “On January 1, 2020, he received an email from the email id ‘essarpetrolpumps.org’ in which he was asked to pay Rs 35,500 to register with the company.”

On January 3, Mehta paid the amount through RTGS (real time gross settlement). On January 4, he received an email asking him to pay a licence fee of Rs 85,000 and he paid the amount. Seven days later, a person identifying himself as Arun Jayaswal called Mehta and informed him that he would not need to pay any other fees. But on January 13, a man identifying himself as Mukesh Khurana asked Mehta to pay Rs 2.20 lakh more as deposit. Later, Jayaswal called Mehta and told him to pay the amount.

But as Mehta became suspicious, he approached the area manager of Essar in Patan who told him to contact the company’s Ahmedabad office. Two officials of the company in Ahmedabad — Chirag Rana and Diptesh Mathur —told Mehta that he had been cheated. The officials also told him that they had received four such complaints.

After acquiring Essar Oil in 2017, a consortium of companies led by Russia’s Rosneft renamed Essar Oil as Nayara Energy. However, it continues to operate its fuel retailing network under the brand name of ‘Essar’. “We are not aware of this particular incident. Our on-boarding process follows stringent protocols and processes for awarding dealership. As the fastest-growing pan-India private fuel retail network, we proactively inform those desirous to be our franchisee about our best practices and caution them about unauthorised persons/company/websites that can lead to defrauding and cheating. To this effect, we have alerted the general public by issuing a caution notice that is also available on our website,” said a company spokesperson of Nayara Energy.

Title: One dies in truck accident on NH8
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

The accident occurred on Friday morning

Vadodara: Traffic came to a standstill for a while on the national highway when two trucks collided in an accident that took place early on Friday morning. One person died in the accident while another person is seriously injured.

According to the police, the incident occurred when a truck was moving from Ahmedabad to Surat and the driver, who couldn’t see the truck which was parked by the roadside on the highway near Tarsali bypass. The speeding truck rammed into it. While the cleaner of the speeding truck died on the spot, the driver survived the accident.

A team of firemen reached the spot and cut open the mangled truck to save the driver. The police have registered an offence and begun investigations in the case.

Title: Political leaders booked for cheating, extortion in separate cases
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: Local leaders of two political parties have been booked recently for fraud and extortion. A senior woman leader, representing a political party in power, was arrested by Bajaj Nagar police on January 21 for siphoning off almost Rs11 lakh in the name of a car loan from a private financial institute. Another group of political party workers was booked for extortion by Pardi police on Friday, while they were trying to extort money from a betel-nut trader by threatening to ‘expose’ him.

In the first case, women unit wing leader of Prabhag 10 Savita Kadwe was arrested by Bajaj Nagar police after her involvement in a racket to dupe a financial institute in the name of car loan came to fore. Kadwe, immediately after the arrest, complained of illness and got herself admitted at hospital where she was taken for medical examination as part of arrest procedures. Cops have reserved their right to take her custody remand after discharge.

After Kadwe’s arrest, Bajaj Nagar police have also registered an offence against Swati Pawar and Swapnil Ramteke for posing as government officials to dupe the financial institute to the tune of Rs9.61 lakh.

In Friday’s incident, Zonal DCP Neelotpal cracked down on the group of political workers led by Nagesh Dedmuthe, who tried to allegedly extort Rs10,000 per month from betel traders Narendra Dahikar and Sanjay Jaiswal at Pardi. Apart from Dedmuthe, his two accomplices, Rakesh Jadhav and Vicky Meshram, too have been named in the FIR. Police are now trying to ascertain the roles of others involved with Dedmuthe.

Later in the evening, Dedmuthe too issued a press release, claiming that he was wrongly framed. Dedmuthe also said that he had alerted the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and also police control room about poor quality of betel nut being stored at the godown before leaving for the place.

Dahikar, who lodged a police complaint against Dedmuthe, said the political group had barged into their godown and asked for ‘payment’ to suppress the issue of stocking bad quality betel nut, but his workers informed him. “There is nothing for which we are supposed to pay any political group that is summoning police to raid us,” he said.

It’s learnt that the cops reached the place after Dedmuthe called up the control room. As Pardi police were inquiring into the issue, DCP Neelotpal too visited the place on hearing about the so-called raid. He is learnt to have asked Pardi police to take necessary action since the political group could not explain their present there.

Sources said Dedmuthe and his gang had conducted a similar raid last week at Kalamna, where also cops were present. A press note was also issued by Dedmuthe’s outfit saying he had got the raid conducted.

Sources in the trade said some political groups are active in the city in extorting money from betel nut traders, threatening to expose them and file complaints with police and other agencies.

Title: Three-member committee completes obstacle survey of airport
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

Kolhapur: The three-member committee of the Airports Authority of India (AAI) completed the obstacle survey of the Kolhapur airport which will soon be submitted to Kolhapur Airport Director Kamalkumar Kataria.

Kataria told TOI that the obstacles have been mapped by the authorities with the help of Global Positioning System (GPS) in and around the 15km area. The survey was conducted from January 13 to 23. Kataria said that he will forward the report to the senior authorities.

He added that once the obstacles are removed and the necessary systems such as night landing facility are installed, the Kolhapur airport will be able to host flights even during night as well as poor weather conditions.

“The run-way expansion work is also underway and will be completed in the coming months. The additions of these new services will surely help in adding more routes to Kolhapur,” he said.

When asked about the shifting of the temple in the midst of the runway expansion work, Kataria said that it is under progress and will soon be completed.

“If everything goes well, the temple will be shifted within next week. It will be helpful for the speedy runway expansion work,” he said.

The current Kolhapur airport runway is of around 1,300m in length while after the expansion, it will be around 2,300m. After the expansion, heavy aircraft, too, will be able to land at the airport, said officials..

Tej Ghatge, airport advisory committee member, said that the current developments at the Kolhapur airport are quite important and will pave way for its future growth. The fact that the airport caters to some major destinations in the present conditions speaks volumes about its importance.

It has to be noted that the airport is going through development works worth Rs 274 crore which include 14 km compound wall, Rs 80 crore runway expansion, Rs 65 crore terminal building and air traffic control tower.

At present, the airport is served by Air Alliance, IndiGo, and TruJet on the Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Tirupati and Mumbai routes respectively. The airport is located at the Ujalaiwadi neighbourhood which is around 9 km from the city.

Title: Gujarat: Chief secretary, DGP visit Motera stadium
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Senior state administration and police officials check the stadium

AHMEDABAD/GANDHINAGAR: State government chief secretary Anil Mukim and director general of police (DGP) Shivanand Jha visited the newly built Motera stadium on Friday, prior to the likely visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump, to inaugurate the stadium on February 23.

Municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra, police commissioner Ashish Bhatia, special police commissioner Ajay Tomar and other senior officers accompanied Mukim to oversee the preparedness at the stadium. Mukim made key suggestions and discussed security arrangements.

The new stadium has been built at a cost of Rs 800 crore. Though none of them were ready to talk about Trump’s visit, a police official said they have come to the security review of the stadium as it is likely to be handed over to the Gujarat Cricket Association by the start of the second week of February.

Government sources said an informal communication was received from the government of India, asking the state government to make necessary arrangements for a possible visit by the US President along with PM Modi.

Title: Thai Amavasai celebrated in the southern districts
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: About one lakh people came to Rameswaram on the occasion of Thai Amavasai on Wednesday to pay tributes to their forefathers. Special arrangements were also made at temples in the southern districts. Thai Ammavasai, the new moon day in the month of Thai, is considered auspicious to pay respects to the souls of departed elders.

People were seen thronging the agni theertham by the sea near the Sri Ramanathaswamy temple in Rameswaram as early as 3am on Wednesday to participate in rituals conducted by priests seated in rows on the beach. Parking facility was made a kilometre away from the temple. The district administration and temple authorities had taken steps to provide basic amenities to the people who came to the temple and tight security arrangements was also in place.

Long queues were visible at the Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar temple in Madurai from early morning as the temple deity Meenakshi was adorned with the diamond crown on the occasion on Wednesday. A large number of people also participated in the rituals held at the Inmayil Nanmai Tharuvar temple in the city.

The Tiruchendur temple in Tuticorin district and the Mookadal sangamam in Kanyakumari district also saw thousands of people taking a dip in the sea as part of the rituals on the auspicious day. People also went to Sathuragiri hills to the Sundaramahalingam temple as police and forest officials regulated the crowd uphill.

Title: Only 36% getting free coaching apply for Neet
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Madurai: Only around 36% of the students, who have enrolled in the free government National Eligibility cum Entrance Test-Under Graduate (NEET) coaching classes, have applied for the exam to be held in May this year, according to the data available so far with the district education officials.

A total of 510 Class XII students have enrolled in Madurai so far for the free government NEET coaching classes.

Out of them, only 182 students have applied for the upcoming exam. Among the 182 students, 96 students are from Tamil medium and 86 English medium. Education officials said that though it was not the final figure, the number is not expected to go beyond 50%.

“Not all students can cope with the pressure and workload to prepare for NEET as well as board exams. There is no flexibility. Preparing for NEET requires a different focus, which is in contrast to board exams. At the same time, since you cannot be assured of a seat, you have to focus on board exams too. This dilemma is making MBBS seat seem like a far-off dream,” said a government school teacher, who takes classes for NEET preparation.

Students also echoed similar concerns and said that teachers did not even encourage low and average-scoring students in Class X to take science groups.

“If I don’t succeed despite working so hard for NEET, then my whole future may get spoiled so why take risk. There are other career choices that are easier, I feel. Teachers also suggested taking arts group when I joined Class XI because it is easier,” said a government school student, who did not wished to be named.

Although coaching has started for Class XI students, too, from this year so that it is easier for them in Class XII, many students feel the coaching classes lack the structure for comprehensive preparation.

“When compared to private coaching, we are of course at a disadvantage. The faculty, too, while some are dedicated and teach really well, others are disinterested. The time for classes is also limited and there is a lot of burden that falls on us. We don’t get as many chances to practice online tests too,” said a NEET aspirant undergoing free coaching.

Title: Over Rs 3L fake notes recovered, two held
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: Special Operations Group (SOG) arrested two persons for manufacturing and smuggling counterfeit Indian currency and recovered fake Rs 3.28 lakh from the accused.

The arrested persons were identified as Sardar Gurjar (25) and Surendra Kumar (22).

Anil Paliwal, ADG, SOG and ATS said, “On a tip off, we found that few persons were suspected of smuggling counterfeit Indian currency. We started keeping a watch on Benar road and one of the teams stopped two youths on a bike. On being searched, we found the fake currency from them.”

The accused had 14 bundles of fake money in denominations of Rs 100 and Rs 200 out of which 898 notes were of the former, while the remaining were of the latter. The money was wrapped in a white paper and cops said that it was supposed to be delivered to a pre-decided location but the accused were apprehended before they could execute the task.

According to the investigation, Sardar used a computer and a printer to manufacture the fake currency which were also seized by the cops.

Police is also questioning the accused to find details about the entire operation and find if more people were involved in the counterfeit scam.

Last year, three smugglers were arrested at Jaisalmer border in Phalodi area and recovered counterfeit bank notes of denominations Rs 100, Rs 200 and Rs 500 having a face value of Rs 96,000. The consignment was to be delivered to a smuggler at Loharki village under Ramdeora police station area.

Title: Datke likely to continue as city BJP chief
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: Top BJP leaders from the district will appoint new presidents of party’s city and district units on Saturday afternoon. Pravin Datke is the interim city BJP president while the post of BJP district president is vacant following the resignation of Rajiv Poddar.

Sources said in all likelihood, Datke would be appointed full-time president for three years. Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari, leader of opposition Devendra Fadnavis and former guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule will choose a new district president.

Names of Hingna MLA Sameer Meghe, Kamptee MLA Tekchand Sawarkar, former MLA Sudhir Parwe, district general secretary Arvind Gajbhiye and senior leader Anandrao Raut are doing the rounds. Though a source said Meghe is not keen on becoming the president.

Other than the two presidents, the three leaders will also appoint assembly constituency-wise presidents. Three names in the city have already been unanimously cleared while there were two strong claimants for the remaining three. Gadkari, Fadnavis and Bawankule met late on Friday night to finalize the names.

Poddar had resigned following party’s poor performance in the six rural seats of the district. In 2014, BJP had won five out of six seats. This time, it lost Ramtek, Umred and Katol seats. Poddar, who was party candidate from Saoner, himself lost badly.

Title: Strive hard to serve people, Kiran Bedi tells officials of UT
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Puducherry: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has urged officials of the territorial administration to strive hard to serve all sections of people and not be bogged down due to vested interests that plot to weaken their resolve to perform their duty.

In an open letter to the officials on Friday, Bedi said she was aware that they were being ‘browbeaten time and again’.

She said the vested interests have launched attempts to overawe them or make them ineffective or compromise or reconcile or weaken their resolve in problem-solving or doubt their own capacity and capability.

She pointed out that the officials must work for the benefit of the people, who do not have the courage and capacity to raise their voice for their basic needs or do not have the capacity to make decisions due to hidden constraints. She insisted that they focus on all sections of people and not only a few.

“Several vested interests have already been broken through in Puducherry in the recent past by conscientious team members and complex situational decision making which is cleaning up the Augean stables. I am aware that it is not a pleasant situation to be in always. But that is what life is all about. But all I can say is that it was and will remain inevitable in situations, personal and professional. And in administration anywhere. Losers at times are known to become desperate when they see options close. Understand them. It’s the way of human nature. But we must remain professional. Because this is our accountability. We are here to improve matters whatever the price. This is expected of us,” she said in the letter.

She said the current situation they face will neither be the first time nor the last. “Observe and learn and perform. As long as we are upright and honest in our intention, we remain protected. We remain accountable too. Remain aware and deal as the situations arise. Observe and respond. Not react. All we are expected to do is remain professional and forthright,” she said.

She said the officials will be protected as long as they follow the laws, rules and regulations. She urged them not to feel weak while defending the rules. “Bullying in the form of harassment does not last long. It is stressful though. But that is what personal and professional training is for, to deal with such situations time to time,” she said.

A Congress MLA had earlier raised a breach of privilege issue against four officials, including the chief secretary, for releasing an advertisement to select a state election commissioner (SEC) following Bedi’s direction bypassing the government’s appointment of Balakrishnan as SEC. The privilege committee of the legislative assembly has begun a probe into the charges levelled by the MLA.

Title: Mother dies with daughter
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: A 26-year-old woman and one of her two daughters died after the former consumed poison and gave it to her daughters. The woman identified as Sarika Ganesh Chavan and her three-month-old daughter Payal died at Chhatrapati Pramilaraje Hospital on Thursday night.

According to the police, Sarika had consumed poison on Tuesday and gave the same to her two daughters. While being taken to the hospital, they started vomiting. The 2-year-old daughter Shreya’s condition has been improving in the hospital. Police said that Sarika had not left any suicide note. Preliminary investigation indicate that she was mentally stable. Her husband worker at a construction site.

Youth suicide

A 34-year-old man committed suicide in his residence near Nagla Park. The deceased identified as Nagraj Subhash Rewankar hanged himself from his ceiling fan. He used to work as an agent of second-hand cycle. Police have found a suicide note, in which some names have been mentioned. His family members said that he was depressed because of a large amount of recovery for long time.

Fatal

A 42-year-old man died in a road accident on Shirol road on Thursday evening. The deceased has been identified as Amol Balasaheb Ghare. His two-wheel collided with another motocycle near a petrol pump. Amol Balasaheb Ghare (42) met with a fatal accident Shiroli road on Thursday evening. Amol met when accident when his two-wheeler collided head on with another two-wheeler near a petrol pump. He died on the spot because of over bleeding because of severe head injuries. Amil was returning home after meeting his relatives. He is survived by is wife, a son, a daughter and parents. He was taken to hospital but was declared dead on arrival.

Three arrested

Ichalkaranji police has arrested three persons in connection with robbery. They have been identified as Rohit Gajana Jadhav, Saurabh Makardhwaj Mane and Shubham Nitin Bhosale . Police said that three forcibly stopped three workers and decamped with cash of rs 21,000 and cell phones. Three are history sheeters and are suspects in a rape case Arrested have been remanded to three days police custody.

Title: Stir by pvt vehicles hits students, office goers
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: Commuters dependent on the private public transport had a troublesome day on Friday as vehicles varying from taxis, autos, private buses and trucks observed one day strike in the city on Friday.

Schoolchildren remained the worst-affected as at many places the school vans did not turn up to pick them up.

The strike was called by Jaipur Commercial Vahan Mahasangh, a federation of 17 different unions including auto rickshaw union, e-rickshaw union, private bus operators union and truckers union in protest of privatization of the fitness Centre by the transport department.

Since morning, the parents of school going children were in tizzy when they were informed by their carriers to drop and pick up their children on their own.

Similarly, those commuting to their offices in private buses, auto rickshaw, e-rickshaw and taxi were also been affected by the strike which invoked a mixed response.

At the Jaipur airport the travellers were affected as those who called the strike did not allow the private taxis to enter inside the airport.

“It was a successful protest in which 17 different unions participated in the strike. Those who participated included Jaipur Transport Operators Association, All Rajasthan Tourist Car Association, Pink Nagar Auto Driver Mazdoor Union, Bus Operators Association. Due to the strike, 18,000 auto rickshaws, 10,000 taxis, 4,000 buses and 5,000 trucks were not available for service,” said Anil Anand, convener of Jaipur Commercial Vahan Mahasangh

On the strike he added that fitness centre is now in the hands of private persons. “They are fleecing us and it has also enhanced corruption. We were though invited by the transport commissioner for the talks, the transport department failed to give us any amicable solution,” he added. Transporters have been objecting for shifting the Fitness centre of private vehicles on Ajmer road, which is 35 km away from the city.

Title: Intercollegiate talent hunt on Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Vaibes 2020 , an intercollegiate talent hunt , will be held at Tagore theatre on Sunday. The aim of the event, organized by Vaibes Media Inc in association with Limax advertising, is to create awareness on lifestyle, health, career and responsibilities among the younger generation. The event unveils various opportunities to the youngsters based on their aptitude, skills and passion.

The talent hunt show is meant for those aged 18-23, studying in various professional, arts and science as well as private colleges. Winners will be bestowed with Mr and Ms Vaibes title. The selected students will be the ambassadors of Vaibes throughout the year and will participate in all programmes in the coming year.

The event will have various competitions like Ted Talk, best management team, he and she entrepreneurship, mime, best advertisement team, dance-solo and group, voice of vaibes, spot choreography, photography, Tik Tok, Mr & Ms Vaibes, treasure hunt, target games, among others.

Chief secretary Tom Jose, DGP Loknath Behera and VSSC director S Somanath will interact with the students during the event. tnn

Title: Cops shift Haldwani protesters on third day of stir
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

DEHRADUN: During the early hours of Friday, police swooped down on hundreds of women and children, agitating for the third day against CAA and NRC at at Taj Chauraha which is being called Haldwani ’s Shaheen Bagh, and shifted them to another spot nearby, while imposing Section 144 across the town.

The protesters though claimed they will continue their protest irrespective of these actions. While the protest at Taj Chauraha, which started on Wednesday, was slated to continue till Friday, another organisation, ‘Samvidhaan Bachao Manch’ will hold a 72-hour-long protest in Haldwani from Saturday onwards.

On Friday, police had asked protesters to end their agitation, citing law and order problems. After failing to convince the crowd comprising mainly of women, along with their children, to end their 72 hour-long protest, the cops allowed them to sit at gali number 8, some 400m away from the Taj crossing.

“Does it appear we were disturbing law and order earlier, and are not doing so anymore, now that we have been moved just 400m further interior? The cops came here just to intimidate us. Since they failed, they used Section 144 to move us,” said Rukhsara Begum, 50, who is sitting on protest since Thursday morning.

According to Danish Ali, another protester, cops acted on the orders of the state government, as the protest got “huge response, both from locals and political parties.”

“From Congress MLA Indira Hridayesh to local SP and BSP leaders, many have joined our protest, which gained momentum over the last 48 hours. That’s why the administration decided to shift us. Otherwise, we were not causing any inconvenience to people,” he added.

Haldwani circle officer D C Dhaundiyal meanwhile had another version to offer.

He told TOI the protestors were shifted to gali number 8 as the number of protesters had fallen.

“By Thursday night, just a couple of women were left at the protest site, after others returned home. So we asked them to relocate,” he said, adding Section 144 was imposed on Thursday night, but only in few areas of the town.

Title: ‘Short circuit’ triggers fire, tent gutted
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Allahabad: A tent was reduced to ashes after a out in sector 3, under Khak Chowk police station, on the Magh Mela ground on Friday evening. No loss of lives or injuries were reported in the incident.

Fire department officials suspect that a short circuit might have triggered the blaze. Seers associated with Veeram Asharaj Lok Sadhna Kendra were living in the camp, where the fire broke out.

Chief fire officer (Magh Mela) Yatindra Nath Umrao said, “The fire was controlled within 10 minutes.” A short circuit might have led to the fire, he added.

Title: NIT should go as two planning authorities not needed: Citizens
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: Guardian minister Nitin Raut of Congress and BJP-ruled Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) are at loggerheads over dissolution of the Nagpur Improvement Trust ( NIT ). While BJP wants to dissolve it and its chief minister Devendra Fadnavis had almost done the job, Raut wants to strengthen it further. Mayor Sandip Joshi has taken steps to scuttle Raut’s move.

Nagpurians, who were contacted by TOI, feel that NIT should go. They said that there was no need for two planning authorities in the city as it added to the confusion and led to harassment of citizens. Also, it led to double taxation for some.

Pramod Pande, president of social organization Jan Manch, said that he strongly opposed the existence of NIT. “As per the seventy-fourth constitutional amendment, there should only be one planning authority in one city. NIT, therefore, has no reason to exist. The government is strengthening it to increase corruption,” he added.

Architect Ashok Mokha also expressed similar views. “All cities across the world have only one planning authority. Nagpur is perhaps the only one that has two. Everywhere, the municipal corporation is the planning authority and so there is no doubt that the same should be the case in Nagpur,” he said.

Tejinder Singh Renu, secretary of Vidarbha Taxpayers’ Association (VTA), said that his organization had always supported moves that simplify government working. “We have been against NIT right from the beginning. A parallel authority only leads to harassment of citizens. NIT lease holders have to pay ground rent as well as property tax. If only one agency manages the city, we can have a single window system. Besides, two authorities increase administrative expenses, which are ultimately recovered from taxpayers. I urge Raut to change his stand in the interest of the city,” he further said.

Senior Congress corporator Praful Gudadhe refused to comment, saying the party’s stand would be announced in the general body meeting of NMC on Monday.

Environmentalist Shrikant Deshpande also feels that all NIT areas should be handed over to the NMC. “There is no need for parallel agencies in the city. However, NIT staff should be asked to join NMC, otherwise the exercise will be meaningless. For example, if NIT gardens are handed over to NMC but the staff is not, then how will NMC manage the gardens?” he said.

Activist Anil Wadpalliwar demanded that NIT should be immediately dissolved. “Each and every staffer is corrupt and government should initiate a CID inquiry against them. If they are transferred to NMC, they will ruin its working,” he said.

Title: Preamble to be read in school assemblies
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: The state government has made it mandatory to recite the Preamble of the Constitution from Republic Day in all government schools. This will be held during morning prayers.

Rajasthan will be the fourth state in country after Kerala, Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra who have already issued similar orders earlier this month.

School education minister Govind Singh Dotasra on Friday gave the orders regarding this saying this would help students to understand and assimilate the importance of the principles of the Constitution.

“Our nation is build on the ideas of secularism, democracy, free speech and equality. These are embedded in the Constitution and written specifically in the Preamble of the Constitution. Students must understand the value of it. This practise will help the students to memorise the exact words of the Preamble and will be curious to learn more about it,” said Dotasra.

As per the directions issued by the directorate of secondary education, Bikaner, 25 minutes have been allotted to the morning prayer between which the recitation of the Preamble will be held.

Dotasra said in the beginning teachers would recite the Preamble and later on a group of students will stand in the assembly for Preamble recitation.

Title: SIT makes another arrest in Jamia Millia Islamia rioting case
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) of Delhi Police, probing the cases of rioting at Jamia Millia Islamia on December 15, arrested a man from Batla House of Jamia Nagar after he was identified from a video, pelting stones at cops. Mohammad Fukran had been on the run since the incident.

However, on Thursday, he had come to his house when cops tracked him and handed him over to the SIT. Following the arrest, there was high drama at New Friends Colony police station as Okhla MLA Amanatullah Khan reached there and started demanding Fukran’s release claiming that he was known to him (Khan). The ruckus went on till the wee hours after which the MLA and his men were asked to disperse.

Police said that Fukran was one of the protesters throwing stones at cops and ran into the university after setting buses on fire. Cops had chased these protesters and entered the university.

Meanwhile, police questioned former Congress MLA Asif Mohammad Khan, Jamia leader Ashu Khan, AISA activist Chandan Kumar, who recorded their versions before cops.

Title: Bareilly: Junior doctor dies after her blanket catches fire in hostel room
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: A 24-year-old junior doctor at a city-based medical college allegedly died of burns after her blanket caught fire due to short circuit in room heater while she was asleep in her hostel room.

The incident took place late on Thursday. According to college administration, the junior doctor was sleeping when the fire quickly spread across the room. Notably, the junior doctor had a narrow escape earlier when her room heater caught fire again caused by a short circuit. However, at that time, she was awake and had doused the fire immediately.

DIG Rajesh Pandey , SSP Shailesh Pandey, SP (crime) and other senior police officers, after receiving information, arrived at the hostel premises to take stock of the situation. Police have sent the body for autopsy to ascertain the cause of her death.

The junior doctor came to Bareilly in 2014 and was interning with a medical college after completing her MBBS here. She was staying in a PG hostel inside the college campus. Late on Thursday, a student of MBBS, who was reportedly sleeping in the same room, saw the fire and promptly alerted other hostel inmates. The hostel administration then informed fire tenders and the police. The fire caught the blanket and spread quickly. The building was later evacuated.

The fire was doused by the rescue team of hostel administration, before the arrival of fire tenders and police. However, the junior doctor’s life could not be saved. Her partially burnt body was purportedly found over the heater and the other belongings in the room were badly damaged due to the fire.

The forensic experts were called to collect evidence from the room to investigate the cause of fire. Hostel inmates’ statements were also recorded. The junior doctor was awake till late at night and was with her hostel inmates, medical college sources said.

SSP Shailesh Pandey told TOI on Friday, “There was another girl in the same room who alerted the hostel administration about the fire. We are still not in a position to comment whether the junior doctor died of burn injuries, due to suffocation or any other reason. We are waiting for the autopsy report now. Her family members are on their way to the city and we are waiting for their reaction as well.”

Title: United India dedicates Rs 1.6 lakh smart classroom to government primary school
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Representative image

PUDUCHERRY: United India Insurance Company , Puducherry regional office has sponsored a smart classroom at a cost of Rs 1.6 lakh to Pavendhar Bharathidasan government primary school in Koonuchampet as a part of its corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives.

The company’s chief regional manager M Muthukrishnan dedicated the smart classroom facility in the school in the presence of deputy inspector of schools M G Robert Kennedy and divisional manager R Killi Valavan in a simple function. Speaking on the occasion Muthukrishnan outlined the CSR initiatives undertaken by the company in recent times.

The company manager T Ramalingam gave a presentation on the importance of availing insurance and outlined its benefits.

Established in 1938, the company was nationalized in 1972. Presently it has 1,340 offices providing insurance cover to more than one crore policyholders through more than 18,000 staff members in the country.

The company has also its presence in more than 200 tier two and three towns and villages through its innovative micro offices.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: Government schools pass test, colleges not in syllabus
Content:
For Aam Aadmi Party education has been a top priority.

NEW DELHI: “Yes we are doing politics over education. It is our responsibility to bring education in the purview of politics.” So said Manish Sisodia , deputy chief minister and education minister , while presenting the Delhi budget last year. For Aam Aadmi Party, education has been a top priority and it gave education the highest budgetary allocation among all sectors in the five years since forming the government in 2015.Complete coverage on Delhi electionsChanging government school education meant improving the infrastructure, beautifying schools from the outside and in the classrooms, providing educational and co-curricular facilities and installing security cameras. Where new school buildings weren’t feasible, the government added classrooms to address the problem of overcrowding and for improving the student-teacher ratio. Before all this, the effort began with 54 government schools being transformed into model ones for the rest of replicate in a phased manner. Then came the establishment of five Schools of Excellence, essentially English-medium government schools, and the setting up of 26 new schools.Neetu Bansal, who lives in Ambedkar Nagar’s J Block in south Delhi, said, “In a few years’ time, my daughter’s school has completely changed. I had moved her here from a private school, so not only is she getting better education, but I am also saving a lot of money in school fees.” Meera, waiting to pick up her daughter at another school in the same area, similarly said, “Our children love going to the school now, and teachers too have started taking extra care of their studies.” Her Class VIII daughter simply testified, “In four years, our school has transformed completely.”But it wasn’t just the school infrastructure that the government targeted. School principals and teachers were sent for training abroad, to Oxford and Cambridge universities and the IIMs in the country. It provided amenities, like tablets, to encourage digital learning. A teacher in Subhash Nagar appreciated the opportunities opened up for them, but claimed there now was increased work burden and “continuous surveillance”, the last perhaps a reference to classroom monitoring via CCTV.As part of improving the learning process, the AAP government also introduced skill improvement schemes like Chunauti and Buniyaad, meant to segregate students on the basis of their reading and writing capabilities. Educationists weren’t taken by such innovations, however, arguing that these would affect the children psychologically.The Vishwas scheme was begun to assist students of Class IX who had failed twice and were to appear for the Class X exams under CBSE’s patrachar, or correspondence, mode. In 2017, such students were shifted to the National Institute of Open Schooling. Critics, once again, carped that this was meant only to improve government school pass figures. As Anita Rampal, professor of elementary and social education at Delhi University, said, “Earlier they had the students appearing as patrachar candidates, but their broad results showed they were government students. By sending them to NIOS, they are obscuring their origin.”When Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Dufloo won the Nobel for economics this year, CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed the scheme was based on their model and said the government would continue with it. Where there was no recrimination was with regard to quality improvement, with the government showcasing this in the form of the upward trajectory in pass percentage in Class XII board results.There was wide acclaim too for two path-breaking introductions in government schools: the happiness curriculum and entrepreneurship curriculum. These not only prepare the students for life and career, but also brighten their days in school. Tina Parcha, a Class VIII student in Sangam Vihar, beamed, “This is one period for which I love going to school these days.”The hiccup was the unfilled vacancies of teacher posts and the failure to regularise the appointment of 25,000 guest teachers. In all fairness, AAP did pass a bill in the assembly for their regularisation, but it was not approved by the lieutenant governor on legal and constitutional grounds. A representative guest teacher said, “For five years now, we have been betrayed. The government claims achievements in the field of education, but we have also worked equally hard for this and yet remained uncared for.”The AAP government also scored well with people whose children study privately. Actions have been taken against private schools found violating rules, particularly with regard to fees. Model Town resident Rekha Ahuja commended the government for renovating government schools and ensuring there were no “exorbitant fee hikes in private schools”.In higher education, there has been slow progress, with no word on the 20 new degree colleges promised by AAP in its 2015 manifesto. In Najafgarh’s Mitraon, Sanjay Kumar, said, “We have seen the changes in government schools and parents in general are very happy. But for youngsters who want to study in college, it means travelling long distance every day. In the next five years, a college should come up in our constituency.”

Title: Leopard beaten to death in Budaun didn’t have two canines: IVRI vets
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Image used for representational purpose only

BAREILLY: The postmortem report of an adult leopard which was killed in Budaun on January 12 has stated that the animal’s upper left canine and right lower canine were missing. Veterinarians said they are not sure if leopard lost its canines before or after death. Experts suspect that its one paw was cut down after it was killed.

A source at the Indian Veterinary Research Institute here, where the leopard’s carcass was sent for a postmortem, said, “The cause of death is concussion of brain and contusion in left frontal area.”

The leopard was allegedly beaten to death by a group of villagers soon after it attacked and injured a teenager and another person in a span of two hours. After killing the leopard, one of the villagers cut off a paw of the big cat. Later, it was recovered by the forest department personnel. The following day, an FIR was registered against eight named and 30-35 unidentified villagers under sections of the Wildlife Protection Act. However, no arrest has so far been made. The forest department later constituted a three-member special task force to probe the matter.

The killing of the leopard in Budaun was the third in west UP this month. One leopard each was killed in Bijnor and Moradabad .

After three leopards were killed in west UP this month, the forest department has directed staff to hold meetings with villagers and inform them where to contact them if they spot any big cat. Officials said as most of the villagers do not have details of the forest department, the information at times reaches the forest staff late and time is wasted before rescue operation can be started.

Chief conservator of forests, Rohilkhand zone, Lalit Verma said, “In the Budaun incident, the information about the presence of a leopard here reached the forest department late. We have now asked the forest staff to hold meetings with villagers and share contact details. Besides, if the foresters receive fake information about the presence of a tiger or leopard, they should probe and identify if the animal is a big cat.”

Title: Protests pick up against CAA, NRC in Jaipur & Ajmer
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur/Ajmer: Several civil rights groups under the banner of Samvidhan Evam Loktamtra Bachoa Andolan held an anti-CAA protest march from Shaheed Smarak to the governor’s house on Friday.

The protestors including Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs and Christians gathered at the Smarak holding banners and raising slogans against the CAA .

Addressing the protest, Sawai Singh, the convenor of the protest, said people from all castes and communities are standing together against the draconian Act. “We are the defenders of the Constitution and will go to any extent saving it from the fascist forces,” said Singh.

Rizwan Ahmed, state president of the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), said the protest would continue till the government rolled back its decision. “It is shameful that the Centre has no regard and respect to the sentiments of people. It is a testing time for people to restore democratic values in the nation,” said Ahmed.

A mega protest rally was organised against CCA and NRC in Ajmer which went up to the collectorate where local Muslim bodies handed over a memorandum to the President via the collector to abolish the Act.

There were hundreds of protestors shouting slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and home Minister Amit Shah saying the CCA and NRC was against the Constitution.

Police force was deployed as there was some suspicion that the protest would turn violent. The rally started from Khanpura village and after the special Friday prayers, Muslims started joining the rally from Dargah region.

Protestors have been staging a protest at Dargah Bazaar every Friday.

Title: Delhi elections 2020: Government schools pass test, colleges not in syllabus
Content:
For Aam Aadmi Party education has been a top priority.

NEW DELHI: “Yes we are doing politics over education. It is our responsibility to bring education in the purview of politics.” So said Manish Sisodia , deputy chief minister and education minister , while presenting the Delhi budget last year. For Aam Aadmi Party, education has been a top priority and it gave education the highest budgetary allocation among all sectors in the five years since forming the government in 2015.Changing government school education meant improving the infrastructure, beautifying schools from the outside and in the classrooms, providing educational and co-curricular facilities and installing security cameras. Where new school buildings weren’t feasible, the government added classrooms to address the problem of overcrowding and for improving the student-teacher ratio. Before all this, the effort began with 54 government schools being transformed into model ones for the rest of replicate in a phased manner. Then came the establishment of five Schools of Excellence, essentially English-medium government schools, and the setting up of 26 new schools.Neetu Bansal, who lives in Ambedkar Nagar’s J Block in south Delhi, said, “In a few years’ time, my daughter’s school has completely changed. I had moved her here from a private school, so not only is she getting better education, but I am also saving a lot of money in school fees.” Meera, waiting to pick up her daughter at another school in the same area, similarly said, “Our children love going to the school now, and teachers too have started taking extra care of their studies.” Her Class VIII daughter simply testified, “In four years, our school has transformed completely.”But it wasn’t just the school infrastructure that the government targeted. School principals and teachers were sent for training abroad, to Oxford and Cambridge universities and the IIMs in the country. It provided amenities, like tablets, to encourage digital learning. A teacher in Subhash Nagar appreciated the opportunities opened up for them, but claimed there now was increased work burden and “continuous surveillance”, the last perhaps a reference to classroom monitoring via CCTV.As part of improving the learning process, the AAP government also introduced skill improvement schemes like Chunauti and Buniyaad, meant to segregate students on the basis of their reading and writing capabilities. Educationists weren’t taken by such innovations, however, arguing that these would affect the children psychologically.The Vishwas scheme was begun to assist students of Class IX who had failed twice and were to appear for the Class X exams under CBSE’s patrachar, or correspondence, mode. In 2017, such students were shifted to the National Institute of Open Schooling. Critics, once again, carped that this was meant only to improve government school pass figures. As Anita Rampal, professor of elementary and social education at Delhi University, said, “Earlier they had the students appearing as patrachar candidates, but their broad results showed they were government students. By sending them to NIOS, they are obscuring their origin.”When Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Dufloo won the Nobel for economics this year, CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed the scheme was based on their model and said the government would continue with it. Where there was no recrimination was with regard to quality improvement, with the government showcasing this in the form of the upward trajectory in pass percentage in Class XII board results.There was wide acclaim too for two path-breaking introductions in government schools: the happiness curriculum and entrepreneurship curriculum. These not only prepare the students for life and career, but also brighten their days in school. Tina Parcha, a Class VIII student in Sangam Vihar, beamed, “This is one period for which I love going to school these days.”The hiccup was the unfilled vacancies of teacher posts and the failure to regularise the appointment of 25,000 guest teachers. In all fairness, AAP did pass a bill in the assembly for their regularisation, but it was not approved by the lieutenant governor on legal and constitutional grounds. A representative guest teacher said, “For five years now, we have been betrayed. The government claims achievements in the field of education, but we have also worked equally hard for this and yet remained uncared for.”The AAP government also scored well with people whose children study privately. Actions have been taken against private schools found violating rules, particularly with regard to fees. Model Town resident Rekha Ahuja commended the government for renovating government schools and ensuring there were no “exorbitant fee hikes in private schools”.In higher education, there has been slow progress, with no word on the 20 new degree colleges promised by AAP in its 2015 manifesto. In Najafgarh’s Mitraon, Sanjay Kumar, said, “We have seen the changes in government schools and parents in general are very happy. But for youngsters who want to study in college, it means travelling long distance every day. In the next five years, a college should come up in our constituency.”

Title: CAA resolution in House today
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: The resolution against the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) will be taken up in the assembly on Saturday. The current session is likely to be a two-day affair as the budget session will begin only after the Union budget.

The ruling Congress has decided to bring a resolution expressing its disapproval of the contentious legislation by the Centre as CAA passed by Parliament is discriminatory and therefore unconstitutional. The Congress argued that there is no provision in the Constitution to grant citizenship based on religion.

However, it likely to be acrimonious as the opposition BJP already made it clear that bringing such a resolution was uncalled for as the Supreme Court is already seized of the matter. The apex court will decide the legislation’s legality not assembly, argued the opposition.

The assembly also must ratify the Constitution (126th) Amendment extending reservation to SC and ST in Lok Sabha and state assemblies for another 10 years on Saturday. On Friday, the amendment was tabled in the House by the assembly secretary.

The house will also take up the Rajasthan Krishi Upaj Mandhi (amendment) Ordinance 2019, Rajasthan Jan Aadhaar Authority Ordinance and Rajasthan Goods and Services Taxes (amendment) Ordinance, which were tabled in the house on Friday.

Title: Businessman duped of Rs 12 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Vadodara: A resident of Ajwa Road who runs an optical shop has registered a case of cheating against two persons at Sama police station. Hussain Madarwala told the police that the accused had promised him last year to make him a partner in a company they are going to start in Dubai. They took Rs 11.57 lakh from him but didn’t float the company and later refused to return the money.

According to the police, Madarwala had come in contact with Nasreen Baloochi and Neeraj Chauhan, partners in a company, last year. The accused duo told him about their plans to float a company in Dubai. They said that the proposed company would do currency trading and get into software technology for which they would require Rs 1.5 crore.

When he showed interest in investing, the duo asked him to invest Rs 50 lakh. Madarwala, however, said that he can invest only Rs 10 lakh in the proposed firm. The accused then took cash from Madarwala and also got him to sponsor their flight tickets to Dubai. They also asked Madarwala to sign on some papers and told him that the firm has been registered.

When Madarwala asked for the firm’s registration documents and the duo couldn’t produce any, he got suspicious and asked them to return his money. After the cheques they gave Madarwala bounced, he approached the police.

Title: Delhi assembly elections 2020: Development has won over caste, religion, says Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal took out a road show in west Delhi’s Janakpuri, Tilak Nagar and Madipur constituencies in supp... Read More

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Friday that in Delhi talk of development had won over politics around caste and religion. He was addressing a public meeting in northwest Delhi’s Rohini. He said people would vote for the party which talks about water, electricity, CCTVs and hospitals. “In other states, BJP seeks votes in the name of caste and religion, but Union home minister Amit Shah (during a public meeting) talked about hospitals, schools and unauthorised colonies. People of Delhi have changed politics,” he said.As the AAP chief presented his guarantee card, mentioning 10 assurances to the people of Delhi — including free power, 24-hour drinking water on tap, a pollution-free city, clean Yamuna, better transport, pucca houses to every slum-dweller and world-class education for children — present by his side were the party candidate from Rohini constituency, Rajesh Nama Bansiwala, and the candidate from Nangloi seat, Raghuvinder Shaukeen.The CM said his government would take care of the education of a child from the time he or she is born till graduation. He said his government had improved school infrastructure, was opening new universities and will open as many schools and colleges as possible to provide good education to the children. “We will also take on the responsibility of ensuring quality and affordable healthcare to the people of Delhi, irrespective of whether he or she is rich or poor. We have set up mohalla clinics and polyclinics and improved the infrastructure of government hospitals to provide good healthcare to the people,” he claimed, adding that 11,000 new buses will be deployed in the next five years.Surrounded by hundreds of supporters, Kejriwal took out a road show in west Delhi’s Janakpuri, Tilak Nagar and Madipur constituencies in the morning, in support of Aam Aadmi Party contenders Rajesh Rishi, Jarnail Singh and Girish Soni, respectively.Riding an open jeep, he waved to people and greeted them with folded hands as the procession moved through narrow lanes. Holding placards in support of various schemes of the AAP government, including free healthcare and electricity, AAP supporters and residents of the areas danced to the tune of ‘Lage Raho Kejriwal’, the party’s anthem.Speaking to TOI, the chief minister’s supporters in the crowd said they would surely be voting for the party as nobody had ever worked as much in their area as this party. They had a few concerns like encroachments and potholes but said these issues were small compared to all the perks that have been given to them by the CM.“Kejriwal ji has been the best chief minister Delhi has ever had and all the problems that came to his notice have been addressed in his ongoing tenure. He took care of the poor and their needs. He is like one of us, so why not vote for someone who is genuinely working for the betterment of the citizens of Delhi,” said Lakhan Singh, a resident of Mahavir Enclave in Janakpuri constituency.A resident of Bindapur, Asha Devi, said the roads were broken but “there are bigger issues to be addressed and Kejriwal has made all those things possible. I will surely vote for him and so will everyone in my family.”

Title: Delhi assembly elections 2020: Development has won over caste, religion, says Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal took out a road show in west Delhi’s Janakpuri, Tilak Nagar and Madipur constituencies in supp... Read More

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Friday that in Delhi talk of development had won over politics around caste and religion. He was addressing a public meeting in northwest Delhi’s Rohini. He said people would vote for the party which talks about water, electricity, CCTVs and hospitals. “In other states, BJP seeks votes in the name of caste and religion, but Union home minister Amit Shah (during a public meeting) talked about hospitals, schools and unauthorised colonies. People of Delhi have changed politics,” he said.

As the AAP chief presented his guarantee card, mentioning 10 assurances to the people of Delhi — including free power, 24-hour drinking water on tap, a pollution-free city, clean Yamuna, better transport, pucca houses to every slum-dweller and world-class education for children — present by his side were the party candidate from Rohini constituency, Rajesh Nama Bansiwala, and the candidate from Nangloi seat, Raghuvinder Shaukeen.

Complete Coverage on Delhi Elections

The CM said his government would take care of the education of a child from the time he or she is born till graduation. He said his government had improved school infrastructure, was opening new universities and will open as many schools and colleges as possible to provide good education to the children. “We will also take on the responsibility of ensuring quality and affordable healthcare to the people of Delhi, irrespective of whether he or she is rich or poor. We have set up mohalla clinics and polyclinics and improved the infrastructure of government hospitals to provide good healthcare to the people,” he claimed, adding that 11,000 new buses will be deployed in the next five years.

Surrounded by hundreds of supporters, Kejriwal took out a road show in west Delhi’s Janakpuri, Tilak Nagar and Madipur constituencies in the morning, in support of Aam Aadmi Party contenders Rajesh Rishi, Jarnail Singh and Girish Soni, respectively.

Riding an open jeep, he waved to people and greeted them with folded hands as the procession moved through narrow lanes. Holding placards in support of various schemes of the AAP government, including free healthcare and electricity, AAP supporters and residents of the areas danced to the tune of ‘Lage Raho Kejriwal’, the party’s anthem.

Speaking to TOI, the chief minister’s supporters in the crowd said they would surely be voting for the party as nobody had ever worked as much in their area as this party. They had a few concerns like encroachments and potholes but said these issues were small compared to all the perks that have been given to them by the CM.

“Kejriwal ji has been the best chief minister Delhi has ever had and all the problems that came to his notice have been addressed in his ongoing tenure. He took care of the poor and their needs. He is like one of us, so why not vote for someone who is genuinely working for the betterment of the citizens of Delhi,” said Lakhan Singh, a resident of Mahavir Enclave in Janakpuri constituency.

A resident of Bindapur, Asha Devi, said the roads were broken but “there are bigger issues to be addressed and Kejriwal has made all those things possible. I will surely vote for him and so will everyone in my family.”

Title: Statue of Periyar defaced near Kanchi
Content:
