This story is from January 25, 2020

Chennai: Miscreants early on Friday vandalised a statue of Dravidian stalwart and social reformer Periyar E V Ramasamy at Kaliyapettai near Salavakkam in Kancheepuram district.

The right hand of the statue was found broken and there were minor cracks on the head, police said.

The incident came to light around 6.15am when a resident found the statue damaged . The defaced portions have been covered. A huge posse of policemen has been deployed at the spot. Senior police officers visited the scene and carried out a detailed investigation.

Villagers, who gathered at the scene, alleged that fans of actor Rajinikanth could be behind the incident. Some of them condemned the daring act. However, police pacified the villagers, promising action against those responsible.

Local functionaries of Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi lodged a complaint with the Salavakkam police following the incident. Police are examining CCTV camera footage in the locality and further investigations are on to trace the culprits.

The 4-ft tall statue was installed by local residents in 1988 and was inaugurated by Dravidar Kazhagam leaders.

The incident has come in the wake of organisations gearing to hold protests against Rajinikanth for his recent speech regarding the anti-superstition rally attended by Periyar in Salem in 1971. Security was also stepped up at the actor’s residence in Poes Garden here to prevent untoward incidents. Police personnel have been deployed near some other statues in Kancheepuram district.

Meanwhile, DGP J K Tripathy warned that police will take strict action against anti-social elements who vandalise statues of Periyar or those of other leaders in the state.

Title: Gang planning to rob pilgrims busted, 5 held
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Allahabad: Five thieves were arrested near Daraganj on Friday while they were planning to rob Magh Mela pilgrims, police said.

The accused were identified as Ram Babu Verma, Murari Verma, Ram Bahadur Sharma, Badri Prasad Gupta and Jai Krishna Bind, all from Mirzapur.

Cops also seized three earrings, two rings, two chains, two ‘mangal sutra’, silver ornaments and cash from them.

Acting on a specific tip off that a Mirzapur-based gang of thieves was planning to rob devotees, a joint team of crime branch (Magh Mela) and Daraganj police carried out a series of raids at possible hideouts near pontoon bridge no 2 and arrested the accused.

Meanwhile, police arrested an auto-lifter, Ashok Kumar Yadav alias Munna Yadav of Phulpur, from Soraon area and recovered two stolen bikes from him.

Ghurpur police also arrested a man, Rajesh Kumar alias Pappu Nishad of Khiri, on charges of illegal mining and seized a sand-laden tractor-trolley.

Title: DRI books 5 gold smuggling cases in a single day at RGIA
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Hyderabad: Hyderabad: DRI sleuths registered five cases of gold smuggling in a single day RGI Airport on Thursday and arrested four persons. “All seizures were made within 4-5 hours on Thursday. We seized about four kilo gold worth Rs 1.66 crore,” said a DRI official.

Early on Thursday, DRI officers rummaged an Air India flight from Dubai and recovered 841 grams of gold biscuits. “They were wrapped in tape and concealed inside a hollow tube under the seat,” said an official.

Later, the sleuths intercepted an Omar Air flight passenger, from Muscat, at the customs check area. In his checked-in baggage, they found 700 grams of gold bars inside a microwave oven.

DRI also intercepted another passenger from Dubai in an Indigo flight and recovered 928 grams of gold paste in capsules in his rectum. Two more passengers from Saudi Arabia in a Saudi Airlines flight also were held for carrying capsules containing gold paste in their rectums. DRI team extracted 797 and 817 grams of gold from the two accused.

Title: SP MLA Nahid Hasan arrested, sent to jail in cheating case
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: Samajwadi Party MLA from Kairana, Nahid Hasan, was on Friday arrested and sent to jail after a local court rejected his bail plea in connection with a cheating case filed against him last year. The MLA was booked on January 17, 2018 after a local, Mohammad Ali, filed a case alleging that he was cheated of Rs 80 lakh by Hasan in a land deal.

Hasan was booked under section 420 (cheating) of Indian Penal Code at Kairana police station. His lawyer Intezar Ali said, “Hasan had nothing to do with this case. We will approach high court for bail soon.”

This is not the only case that MLA Hasan is facing. His trouble started on September 9 last year after a public spat with Kairana’s sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) Amit Pal Sharma when the officer stopped his SUV and asked for its papers. Later, during a probe, it turned out that the vehicle was not registered at all. Hasan was then booked for allegedly misbehaving with the government servant and driving an SUV without valid papers.

Later, district administration and police in Shamli, under which Kairana town falls, decided to dust off 11 old cases filed against the MLA and expedited probe in all of them.

Title: Bhopali Zayka to satiate your taste buds this weekend
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Bhopal: Picture yourself relishing a plate of piping hot kebabs amid icy winds. Feels good! So, get over your TVs and laptops, as Bhopali Zayka Food Festival awaits you this weekend.

Starting this Saturday, the two-day fest will be held at Bittan Market ground from 12 noon to 11pm in the evening.

Bhopali cuisine, with Nawabi and Mughlai dishes as mains will be served. Also, non-vegetarians can enjoy the best of mutton keema and nalli nihari. Apart from food stalls, shopping counters, kidszone and rock bands will entertain your evening.

The entry will be for free on Saturday, while on Sunday it will cost Rs30.

Along with home chefs, the food festival will also have famous brands of bakeries and ice creams.

Title: BJP seeks probe into anti-CAA remarks on FB
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: The BJP on Friday demanded probe into alleged anti-CAA comments on a Facebook account created in the name of IAS officer Tina Dabi in Bhilwara district. The comments were posted last month which the officer claimed was fake and that she has already lodged an FIR. A delegation of BJP met Bhilwara collector and SP and gave a representation on the matter.

PTI

Title: BJP boycotts Rajasthan governor speech, walks out
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

BJP on Friday boycotted governor Kalraj Mishra’s speech and walked out of the assembly.

JAIPUR: The BJP on Friday boycotted governor Kalraj Mishra’s speech and walked out of the assembly.

As soon as Mishra began his address, Opposition leader Gulab Chand Kataria raised objections over the session being called without prior notice of 21 days as per rules of the assembly.

Kataria said the Constitutional amendment extending reservation to SC/ ST in Lok Sabha and assemblies for another 10 years must be ratified by January 25 but the government was careless about it earlier. The session was hurriedly called when the last date of ratification was near, he said.

Kataria said the state government suddenly woke up and decided to call the session with just four days’ notice. A notice must be served 21 days before calling a session so that members can make their preparations, he said.

When the governor continued his address, Kataria announced the decision to boycott the address. BJP ally, Rashtriya Loktantrik Party MLAs, too boycotted the proceedings along with BJP MLAs.

However, there was embarrassing moment for the opposition as former speaker Kailash Meghwal refused to toe the party line.

Meghwal refused to join his party in the ‘protest’ initially. He obliged only after slips were sent to him thrice from the opposition lobby outside the House.

Meghwal said that as the Sspeaker he too had opposed the first session called by the Gehlot government without consulting him and following same rule, but the BJP did not support him then.

About Meghwal’s action, state BJP president Satish Poonia said, “Nobody is above party.”

Title: Govt working on ‘right to healthcare’, says Mishra
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jaipur: Governor Kalraj Mishra on Friday said the government was working to bring a legislation on “right to healthcare” to expand healthcare facilities to all people of the state.

Delivering his address on the first day of the fourth session of the state assembly, which was boycotted by the opposition BJP and RLP MLAs, Mishra said the state government launched ‘Nirogi Rajasthan’ campaign on December 18 last year and was making constant efforts to expand healthcare facilities to the people. He said because of the efforts of the state government, the Centre had sanctioned 15 new medical colleges and 950 additional PG seats at six government medical colleges and was planning to set up an Ayurveda clinic at every panchayat samiti.

Mishra said the state government had so far allocated Rs 47.80 crore as agriculture grant to farmers in six districts — Jalore, Jaisalmer, Barmer, Bikaner, Pali and Jodhpur — where locust attack had damaged crops.

Title: Gas leak sparks fire in a residential society in Sama
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Vadodara: An elderly man was injured in a fire that took place in the Anandvan Society in Sama area of the city on Friday afternoon. A leakage in cooking gas is believed to be the reason for the fire.

According to fire brigade officials, local residents had called the fire brigade control room after seeing smoke emanating from a house in the society. They also told the fire officials that they had heard a blast before smoke came out of the house.

Firemen rushed to the society and entered the house from where the fire was reported. An elderly man Liladhar Yadav (58) was found inside the house. He was injured on his head and was shifted to a hospital in an ambulance.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: EC orders FIR against Kapil Mishra, sends notice on his Pakistan remark
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Kapil Mishra

NEW DELHI: Police on Friday registered an FIR against BJP candidate from the Model Town assembly constituency, Kapil Mishra , under the Representation of the People Act, 1951, for allegedly trying to aggravate differences between two communities.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

The case was filed on the directions of Delhi’s chief electoral officer, Ranbir Singh. Earlier in the day, EC issued a showcause notice to Mishra for his ‘mini-Pakistan' remarks with reference to the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act at Shaheen Bagh in south-east Delhi.

Mishra had on Thursday remarked in a tweet that the February 8 election would be a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan and followed it up with remarks that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi and that Shaheen Bagh was being replicated all over the capital. The EC has already asked Twitter to remove his controversial tweet.

The notice, sent by the office of the returning officer of Model Town assembly constituency, where Mishra is contesting, stated that the remarks violated provisions of Model Code of Conduct and Representation of the People Act and is punishable under law. It stated that in case the reply was unsatisfactory, action would be initiated against Mishra without any further notice.

“People have occupied the streets at Shaheen Bagh. They are not allowing children to go to school and adults to office,” the BJP candidate had said. They have refused to follow Constitution and Parliament. Videos are emerging of children talking about the death of PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah. The site has virtually turned into a mini-Pakistan. It is being backed by political parties.” He had claimed that for political gains, parties were creating Shaheen Bagh-like protest centres. “In such a scenario, Hindustan will stand up against Pakistan and the assembly elections will be a contest between Hindustan and Pakistan,” Mishra had stated.

In a four-page reply, Mishra said his comments had been taken out of context and misrepresented intentionally to paint a one-sided picture for stoking differences. “My statement must be seen in the context of Pakistan’s attempt at sending their proxies to take undue advantage of the prevailing law and order situation in Delhi,” he said.

Mishra appeared to be standing by his remarks which he elaborated upon in the reply. The Shaheen Bagh protests have witnessed presence of politicians and anti-social elements who spew anti-establishment sentiments. Seditious and anti-India slogans have been raised at these protests that solely intend to disturb communal harmony and destroy peaceful co-existence, he said.

He explained in the notice that the Shaheen Bagh protest is not a Delhi-specific issue but a national one. The protests have been going on even before the Delhi assembly election was announced and these are not within the Model Town constituency.

“I have only given my general opinion on the issue and not by way of an election rally or speech. These impugned remarks should not be considered as election related statements. They thus do not fall under the ambit of the Model Code of Conduct or Representation of People Act, 1951,” Mishra stated in his reply.

He pointed out that he had neither named any caste, community, religion or linguistic group, nor did he intend to aggravate any differences to gain electoral benefit. “My statement merely refers to two countries, two entities who are not involved in any election process at the national level at present,” he said, adding that the protests are causing inconvenience to people.

Title: Delhi: Tihar Jail writes to Nirbhaya convicts’ kin
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Jail officials have been swapping the quartets’ cells and not allowing anyone to stay for more than two days i... Read More

Title: Delhi elections: Number of candidates for polls at its lowest ever
Content: NEW DELHI: With 668 candidates left in the fray, the 2020 Delhi assembly polls will witness the lowest number of contestants fighting for 70 seats since 1993 , when the first election of the reconstituted assembly was held.Complete coverage on Delhi electionsThe Delhi election office had received 1,528 nominations from 1,029 candidates (one candidate can file up to four applications) till January 21, the last date of filing nominations. After the scrutiny of documents on January 22 and 23, the election office found 698 nominations valid to contest the polls. On Friday, the last date of withdrawing nominations, 30 candidates opted out leaving 668 candidates to battle it out.In 1993, a record 1,316 candidates had contested the elections, but the number decreased in subsequent polls. In the 2015 assembly polls, 673 candidates — 606 men, 66 women and one transgender — had been in the fray. The gender-wise break up of candidates this year was not known till filing of this report.However, the three major political players — AAP, BJP and Congress — have collectively fielded 24 women candidates this year. While Congress has given tickets to 11, eight are contesting from AAP and BJP has fielded five. In 2015, BJP had fielded eight, AAP six and five had contested on the Congress symbol.Among the prominent candidates who withdrew their nomination on Friday, two were incumbent MLAs from AAP — Mohammed Ishraq (Seelampur) and Jagdeep Singh (Hari Nagar) — and former Congress legislator Asif Mohmmad Khan (Okhla). The three had filed their nominations as Independents after their respective parties denied them tickets.The nomination of former SAD MLA Jitender Singh Shunty, who had filed his nomination as BJP candidate from Shahdara assembly segment, was rejected on Thursday due to technical deficiencies. SAD is not contesting the polls this year.Late on Thursday, the election office had released the break-up of the total voters. A record 1.47 crore voters in the city of over 20 million are eligible to cast their votes this year with the ratio of 73.4 electors per 100 people. There are 824 women per 1,000 male voters this year compared with 819 in the last assembly polls. In 2015, 1.33 crore people were eligible to cast their votes, but only 67% had exercised their franchise.Matiala in west Delhi has the highest number of over 4.2 lakh voters, followed by Vikaspuri (4 lakh), Burari (3.6 lakh), Okhla (3.3 lakh) and Badarpur (3.2 lakh). Chandni Chowk is the smallest constituency in terms of voters with just over 1.2 lakh voters, closely followed by neighbouring Matia Mahal and Delhi Cantonment. Balliamaran and New Delhi are the fourth and fifth smallest assembly constituencies with over 1.4 lakh voters each.

Title: Yadav arrested, gets bail
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Bhopal: Two days after making ‘offensive’ remarks against Rajgarh district collector Nidhi Nivedita, former minister Badrilal Yadav was arrested in Biaora on Friday. An FIR was filed against him at Biaora on Thursday evening under IPC sections 188 and 294 for violation of prohibitory orders and use of abusive language. “He was presented in court, where he was granted bail,” Rajgarh SP Pradeep Sharma said. TNN

Title: Telangana: Four-year-old run over by car in building’s cellar
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Chakali Tharun

HYDERABAD: A four-year-old boy, playing near his house in the cellar of a building in Malkajgiri , died after he came under the wheels of a car of one of the residents on Friday.

The family of Chakali Tharun , the boy, had moved to Hyderabad from Wadat village in Mahbubnagar district about a month ago. Tharun’s father, Rangappa, works as a watchman at Venkat Plaza apartments in road no. 11 of Anand Bagh. Rangappa, his wife and two sons used to stay in a room in the cellar.

On Friday morning, Rangappa was away and his wife, Mahadevi, was inside the room, attending to her four-month-old younger son. Tharun had stepped out of the room to play. “As he went towards the entrance of the cellar, the car that was entering hit him. He fell on the floor and one of the tyres ran over his head,” said Malkajgiri SI P Nageswara Rao .

The boy was rushed to a hospital, where he was declared brought dead. Police identified the person driving the car as J Manohar Sudhakar, 48, a private employee and resident of the building. “The building’s gate was closed. So, Manohar Sudhakar got down from his car, opened the gate and began driving into the cellar. He did not notice the boy ahead,” said the SI.

It was on the instructions of Tharun’s uncle, Laxmaiah, that the family shifted to Anand Bagh from their native place. “After the mishap, Rangappa and Mahadevi called me. I sell fruits near their apartment. At Malkajgiri government hospital, doctors declared him brought dead. I had called them to the city and got Rangappa the watchman’s job. Had I not called them here, my nephew would have been alive,” said an inconsolable Laxmaiah. Police registered a case against Manohar Sudhakar under Section 304-a of the IPC and took him into custody.

Title: Gujarat: One dead, 15 injured in Khambhat rioting
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Rioters pelting stones from a terrace in Khambhat town on Friday

VADODARA/ ANAND: An elderly man died in firing and several others were injured in communal riots that broke out in the sensitive Akbarpura area of Khambhat town of Anand district on Friday.

Though the exact trigger for the rioting was not immediately ascertained, it is suspected that it was a fall-out of some fight between two groups during Uttarayan.

Mobs from both communities resorted to heavy stone pelting at each other and nearly 10 houses and shops were set ablaze and several vehicles vandalized.

Police fired six rounds in the air and lobbed 25 tear gas shells to quell the mob, but the rioters continued to pelt stones even in the presence of cops. At least 15 cops including driver of Anand district superintendent of police (DSP) Makrand Chauhan were injured in stone pelting.

Chauhan confirmed death of Vinod Chavda, a nearly 65-year-old man, who was hit by a bullet when he boarded a rickshaw. According to sources, Chavda hailed from Pangadia village on the outskirts of Khambhat town.

“We are ascertaining whether he died of private firing or government firing,” said Chauhan.

Auto driver Mukesh Rathod, howeverm told reporters that Chavda had boarded the rickshaw from Tran Bati area. “When we were on our way to Lal Darwaja area, a bullet hit him. He died in police firing.

Chauhan said the situation was brought under control but heavy bandobast has been deployed along with constant patrolling to prevent escalation of violation.

Markets in the town closed down immediately after the clash. Till late night, the police was in the process of identifying the rioters.

This is not for the first time that Akbarpura area has been on the boil. In February last year, a petty dispute over children throwing stones at each other had snowballed into communal clashes. Police had to fire seven rounds in the air and lob 22 tear gas shells to bring the situation under control then as the rioters had damaged three vehicles and set five houses on fire leaving a cop injured. Later, 52 accused were booked and arrested.

Title: ‘I believe God is present in every inch of Sangam’
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Devotees take a holy dip in Ganga at Sangam during the Mauni Amavasya snan at Magh Mela ground on Friday

Allahabad: Before the sun rose to greet the city on Friday, Shivdulaari was already up and walking several kilometres to reach the Magh Mela ground.

Her old age no bar, the sexagenarian didn’t mind the exhaustion as she set out to take a dip in Sangam on the Mauni Amavasya snan on Friday.

“I can walk the entire day and can cover several kilometres without feeling tired, such is our belief in Maa Ganga,” said Shivdulaari, who lives in Mahi village.

Shivdulaari was among the crores of devotees who flocked to the Magh Mela ground in Allahabad on Friday to attend the third main snan. According to Hindu tradition, one can seek salvation by taking a dip in Sangam on Mauni Amavasya.

As devotees took a dip in the cold water of Ganga, chants of ‘Har har Gange’ reverberated through the air. Devotees, many from other states as well, started pouring in at the crack of dawn as the ‘muhurat’ of the snan started from 2.40am.

Many walked barefoot, some with help of sticks, while parents were seen carrying children on their shoulders to reach the ghats bank. “I walked barefoot from Allahbad Railway Station to the Mela ground to mark my belief that God is present in every inch of Sangam,” said Ashok Shivpuri, who came from Chauri Chaura in Gorakhpur.

Unlike the tradition of maintaining silence on Mauni Amavasya until a person took a dip, the Mela was abuzz with a cacophony of sounds of chants and various rituals. The air was thick with the fragrance of incense sticks as devotees not only offered prayers, but also served meals to the poor.

“I carried a five-kilogram sack of rice and pulses to distribute among the needy and poor at the Mela,” said Parvati Kumari, a native of Khadra Khurd village.

There were others who chose to serve the animals like birds and dogs at the ground. “Har jeev ko anya miley, koi bhookha na rahe ye Magh ka mahatva (No one should be go hungry, this is the importance of Magh Mela) said,” devotee Amrit Nagar, another devotee from Mahi village. The number of devotees swelled as the day proceeded and many even lost their way while negotiating their way through the rush.

Title: Two wanted criminals injured in encounter, held
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Kanpur: Two criminals , carrying a reward of Rs 25,000 on their head, have been injured and arrested after an encounter under the Sajeti police station area of the district on early Friday morning. Both have suffered bullet wounds in their legs in cross-firing and were admitted to hospital. Police claimed that the accused were involved in heinous crimes, including an attempt to murder and robbery reported from separate police stations of the district in the recent past.

The arrested criminals, identified as Rahul alias Shera (25), who was injured in the encounter, is a resident of Panki while Narain (24) is a native of Chhattapurwa in Sachendi. Both have a criminal record in Bidhnoo and other police stations of the district. Police have recovered two country-made pistols and several live cartridges and a two-wheeler from their possession.

SP (Rural) Pradyumna Singh said, "During the checking near Bagh village Tiraha puliya under Sajeti police station during early hours of Friday, police arrested Rahul and Narain. When they were challenged by the police party and asked to surrender, they opened fire at the police team and tried to run away, but in retaliatory action, they sustained bullet wounds in their leg and later arrested. They have been admitted to a hospital and are out of danger."

Both the criminals were carrying a reward of Rs 25,000 on their head, the police said.

Title: Ex-mgmt of Jain Kalar Samaj booked for over Rs1.2cr fraud
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: The Sakkardara police, following a legal battle in the court, have booked former management body of Jain Kalar Samaj for alleged misappropriation of over Rs1.20 crore. One of its life members, Anil Tidke, has filed the police complaint stating the management prior to 2016 had embezzled the funds.

Tidke, in his complaint, stated that the management under him had taken over the organization from 2016. Earlier, there had been no election since 2004. Following Tidke’s complaint, the charity commissioner had assigned an inspector to conduct investigation into the allegations.

It had surfaced that the earlier body had siphoned off nearly Rs42.21 lakh in a project at Lakhni, another Rs1.63 lakh at Pauni, Rs7.35 lakh in Chamorshi and Rs70 lakh in Bramhapuri. Tidke also complained that the earlier body also had misappropriated rent collected by hiring out the samaj bhavan on Reshimbagh-Umrer road.

As per the police complaint, the earlier body did not ensure proper accounts, audits, balance sheets and also payments through cheques. Tidke also alleged that the earlier management did not follow guidelines of the charity commissioner’s office and flouted various norms.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: EC orders FIR against Kapil Mishra, sends notice on his Pakistan remark
Content:
Kapil Mishra

NEW DELHI: Police on Friday registered an FIR against BJP candidate from the Model Town assembly constituency, Kapil Mishra , under the Representation of the People Act, 1951, for allegedly trying to aggravate differences between two communities.The case was filed on the directions of Delhi’s chief electoral officer, Ranbir Singh. Earlier in the day, EC issued a showcause notice to Mishra for his ‘mini-Pakistan' remarks with reference to the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act at Shaheen Bagh in south-east Delhi.Mishra had on Thursday remarked in a tweet that the February 8 election would be a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan and followed it up with remarks that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi and that Shaheen Bagh was being replicated all over the capital. The EC has already asked Twitter to remove his controversial tweet.The notice, sent by the office of the returning officer of Model Town assembly constituency, where Mishra is contesting, stated that the remarks violated provisions of Model Code of Conduct and Representation of the People Act and is punishable under law. It stated that in case the reply was unsatisfactory, action would be initiated against Mishra without any further notice.“People have occupied the streets at Shaheen Bagh. They are not allowing children to go to school and adults to office,” the BJP candidate had said. They have refused to follow Constitution and Parliament. Videos are emerging of children talking about the death of PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah. The site has virtually turned into a mini-Pakistan. It is being backed by political parties.” He had claimed that for political gains, parties were creating Shaheen Bagh-like protest centres. “In such a scenario, Hindustan will stand up against Pakistan and the assembly elections will be a contest between Hindustan and Pakistan,” Mishra had stated.In a four-page reply, Mishra said his comments had been taken out of context and misrepresented intentionally to paint a one-sided picture for stoking differences. “My statement must be seen in the context of Pakistan’s attempt at sending their proxies to take undue advantage of the prevailing law and order situation in Delhi,” he said.Mishra appeared to be standing by his remarks which he elaborated upon in the reply. The Shaheen Bagh protests have witnessed presence of politicians and anti-social elements who spew anti-establishment sentiments. Seditious and anti-India slogans have been raised at these protests that solely intend to disturb communal harmony and destroy peaceful co-existence, he said.He explained in the notice that the Shaheen Bagh protest is not a Delhi-specific issue but a national one. The protests have been going on even before the Delhi assembly election was announced and these are not within the Model Town constituency.“I have only given my general opinion on the issue and not by way of an election rally or speech. These impugned remarks should not be considered as election related statements. They thus do not fall under the ambit of the Model Code of Conduct or Representation of People Act, 1951,” Mishra stated in his reply.He pointed out that he had neither named any caste, community, religion or linguistic group, nor did he intend to aggravate any differences to gain electoral benefit. “My statement merely refers to two countries, two entities who are not involved in any election process at the national level at present,” he said, adding that the protests are causing inconvenience to people.

Title: Visit Delhi government schools to see revolution in education: Arvind Kejriwal to Amit Shah
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal

अमित शाह जी, दिल्ली की शिक्षा क्रांति देखने के लिए कुछ दिन तो गुजारिए हमारे स्कूलों में। दिल्ली के सरकारी स्कूलों… https://t.co/ipO8KAjo6z — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) 1579881279000

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday invited Union home minister Amit Shah to visit Delhi government schools to witness the revolution in education after the BJP leader stated at a public meeting that the condition of the existing schools had worsened.In a series of tweets, Kejriwal countered Shah for attacking the AAP government during the launch of his extensive election campaign. “We welcome you to government schools. We will work on your suggestions after elections,” Kejriwal tweeted.Taking a swipe at Shah, who had remarked during his rally that his phone battery had drained while searching for free Wi-Fi in the city, Kejriwal said, “Sir, besides free Wi-Fi we have made arrangements for free mobile charging too. 200 units of electricity consumption is free in Delhi.”Responding to Shah’s remarks that 15 lakh CCTV cameras were promised, but only a few were installed, Kejriwal remarked on Twitter that he was happy that the home minister had spotted some cameras. “A few days ago, you had stated that not even a single camera was installed. Please take out time, we will show you schools also. I am very happy that the people of Delhi have changed politics forcing BJP to seek votes on CCTV, schools and unauthorised colonies,” he tweeted.Deputy CM Manish Sisodia invited Shah to his assembly constituency of Patparganj to visit the newly built “School of Excellence”. He also challenged the home minister to showcase a single government school of comparable standards constructed in BJP-ruled states.“Of the 2.8 lakh CCTV cameras, the AAP government has already installed more than 2 lakh. We have also installed more than 1,000 Wi-Fi hotspots,” added Sisodia.

Title: Delhi elections: Number of candidates for polls at its lowest ever
Content: NEW DELHI: With 668 candidates left in the fray, the 2020 Delhi assembly polls will witness the lowest number of contestants fighting for 70 seats since 1993 , when the first election of the reconstituted assembly was held.The Delhi election office had received 1,528 nominations from 1,029 candidates (one candidate can file up to four applications) till January 21, the last date of filing nominations. After the scrutiny of documents on January 22 and 23, the election office found 698 nominations valid to contest the polls. On Friday, the last date of withdrawing nominations, 30 candidates opted out leaving 668 candidates to battle it out.In 1993, a record 1,316 candidates had contested the elections, but the number decreased in subsequent polls. In the 2015 assembly polls, 673 candidates — 606 men, 66 women and one transgender — had been in the fray. The gender-wise break up of candidates this year was not known till filing of this report.However, the three major political players — AAP, BJP and Congress — have collectively fielded 24 women candidates this year. While Congress has given tickets to 11, eight are contesting from AAP and BJP has fielded five. In 2015, BJP had fielded eight, AAP six and five had contested on the Congress symbol.Among the prominent candidates who withdrew their nomination on Friday, two were incumbent MLAs from AAP — Mohammed Ishraq (Seelampur) and Jagdeep Singh (Hari Nagar) — and former Congress legislator Asif Mohmmad Khan (Okhla). The three had filed their nominations as Independents after their respective parties denied them tickets.The nomination of former SAD MLA Jitender Singh Shunty, who had filed his nomination as BJP candidate from Shahdara assembly segment, was rejected on Thursday due to technical deficiencies. SAD is not contesting the polls this year.Late on Thursday, the election office had released the break-up of the total voters. A record 1.47 crore voters in the city of over 20 million are eligible to cast their votes this year with the ratio of 73.4 electors per 100 people. There are 824 women per 1,000 male voters this year compared with 819 in the last assembly polls. In 2015, 1.33 crore people were eligible to cast their votes, but only 67% had exercised their franchise.Matiala in west Delhi has the highest number of over 4.2 lakh voters, followed by Vikaspuri (4 lakh), Burari (3.6 lakh), Okhla (3.3 lakh) and Badarpur (3.2 lakh). Chandni Chowk is the smallest constituency in terms of voters with just over 1.2 lakh voters, closely followed by neighbouring Matia Mahal and Delhi Cantonment. Balliamaran and New Delhi are the fourth and fifth smallest assembly constituencies with over 1.4 lakh voters each.

Title: Police seize materials from mining site
Content:
This story is from January 25, 2020

Nagpur: The Khapa police on Friday seized concrete slabs, rods and other materials from the accident site of manganese mine at Gumgaon , around 24km from Nagpur, in Saoner tehsil. Panchanama too was completed at the spot. The incident had taken place at around 400 feet under the surface.

An Indian and Chinese mine worker were killed after the roof of the mine caved in at the site of Manganese Ore of India Limited (MOIL). China Coal C3 (India) Private Limited has been awarded the work of high speed shaft sinking at the place. Another two, also including a Chinese national, were injured in the accident.

Khapa police had registered an offence of causing death due to negligence against MOIL’s assistant manager Prashant Geharwal and Chinese company’s security personnel Vijay Kumar Swaraj Singh along with others whose names are yet to be ascertained.

Police said the place has been sealed for operation until it is cleared as safe for the labourers by a special committee of MOIL.

Apart from MOIL’s special committee, the directorate of mines safety too has taken up the probe at its own level. A senior official of the directorate said that their inquiry is underway.

It’s also learnt that the Chinese government is set to send a team comprising higher officials of the company and some experts for inspection at the site.

Title: Visit Delhi government schools to see revolution in education: Arvind Kejriwal to Amit Shah
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal

अमित शाह जी, दिल्ली की शिक्षा क्रांति देखने के लिए कुछ दिन तो गुजारिए हमारे स्कूलों में। दिल्ली के सरकारी स्कूलों… https://t.co/ipO8KAjo6z — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) 1579881279000
